What are a few basic phrases in french i would need to get around if im visiting Paris?  "Bonjour, Madame" = "Hello, Ma'am"
"Bonjour, Monsieur" = "Hello, Sir"
(Always greet people before asking for assistance. The French do this and will consider you polite if you do likewise.)

"Excusez-moi de vous déranger." = "Excuse me for bothering you"
(Especially helpful if you need to ask a stranger for help.)

"Où se trouve le musée du Louvre?" = "Where is the Louvre museum?"

"ça coûte combien?" = "How much does that cost?"

And of course:
"Merci!" = "Thank you!"
"Bonjour!" = "Hello!"
"Au revoir!" = "Goodbye"


For additional phrases, see the following links. You also might consider purchasing a French language instruction cassette or DVD (Berlitz or Pimsleur's) to help with pronunciation.

Bon voyage! (Have a good trip!)

by committing suicide, do you go to hell?  No. Not because of the act itself. There is no sin that cannot be forgiven, except the rejection of Christ as your Savior. While suicide is a terrible/tragic thing, it is not unforgivable.

Note: I see that there are many responses that indicate a person would "automatically" go to hell for this sin. I disagree with that. We are not saved by our actions. We are saved by grace through faith. Is God's grace nullified when we sin? No. While repentance is very important, it is NOT a means of grace. We do not "earn" forgiveness via our repentance. I'm sure that many, many Christian will die with some sin they never had a chance to repent of...that does not nullify the grace of God. 

All that being said, life is a gift from God! We should use the days that He has given us wisely.

Baron, Marquis, Duke and Arch Duke. What are those? Is that English? And what is the equal degree in British Royalty? Marquis is a nobleman in England of a rank next below that of duke. 
Originally, the marquis was an officer whose duty was to guard the marches or frontiers of the kingdom. The office has ceased, and the name is now a mere title conferred by patent.

Duke is one of the highest order of nobility after princes and princesses of the royal blood and the four archbishops of England and Ireland.

Baron is a title or degree of nobility; originally, the possessor of a fief, who had feudal tenants under him; in modern times, in France and Germany, a nobleman next in rank
below a count; in England, a nobleman of the lowest grade in the House of Lords, being next below a viscount.

ArchDuke, formerly this title was assumed by the rulers of Lorraine, Brabant, Austria, etc. It is now appropriated to the descendants of the imperial family of Austria through the make line, all such male descendants being styled archduke, and all such female descendants archduchesses.

How do you define Etiquette?  Oh come on guys...he didn't say 'what's the definition of etiquette,' he said 'how do you define' it.  This means he's asking for a personal definition.  Maybe someone can't understand the dictionary version...maybe he's just curious...

Wow, such hostility.

Etiquette is the set of rules that humans have devised for ourselves to make it much more likely that we can pass through a day without wanting to jab another human in the face with a pointed stick.

Yes, the rules can be fancier...salad forks, chafing dishes, which hand to shake with and which to shun, but when it really comes down to it, it's How to Keep Violent Hairless Monkeys from Killing Each Other.

There IS a further refinement to etiquette.  This is the etiquette used to define the group.  If one does not know the Secret Handshake, does not know that the chafing dish goes over HERE, not there...then we know he's an Outsider and must Not Be Trusted.  So that would be etiquette refined down to the point of not simply getting along, but protecting the group as well.

is god dependant of morality or independant?  I think that's a really good question. If I accept the premise that God cannot ask us to do anything that is not moral, then that implies there is a morality independent of Him. On the other hand, if I accept the position that I must do whatever God wants me to do, then I have no way to ascertain whether God is asking me to do right or wrong - I must simply do what He says.

does anyone know a Spanish radio station in Kenya? the call numbers? I would like to know so that i can have a better accent and understanding of the language. 1. CLARITY OF QUERY

(a) whether you meant (i) a Kenya-based radio station that broadcasts in Spanish or (ii) a radio station based elsewhere that broadcasts to Kenya in Spanish;

(d) whether you rely totally on short-wave radio, or whether you have other forms of access - digital, satellite and internet.   

2. KENYAN RADIO
It is highly unlikely that any local broadcaster (e.g. KBC) will broadcast in Spanish. You'll get English, Swahili and other local languages.

3. REGIONAL RADIO 
You have no nearby Spanish-speaking country (the nearest is Equatorial Guinea), so picking up radio signals will be difficult. 
http://www.mininfo-equatorial-guinea.org/es/radio.htm 
http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/africa/country_profiles/1023151.stm

4. SPANISH RADIO 
Here is the African broadcast schedule of Radio Exterior de España, which is probably your best opportunity.  
http://www.rtve.es/rne/ree/Areas/africa.htm

5. OTHER NATIONAL BROADCASTERS (SPANISH-LANGUAGE) 
There are plenty of large national corporations that transmit programmes internationally, and in Spanish, via short wave and digital radio, but it is unlikely that their Spanish programmes will be beamed towards East Africa. However it may be worth exploring. Most of them will be accessible on the internet. They include the following:
(a) BBC World Service / BBC Mundo 
http://www.bbc.co.uk/radio/
(b) Radio Bulgaria 
http://www.bnr.bg/en/
(c) SBS Radio (Australia) 
http://www9.sbs.com.au/radio/
(d) Voice of Russia 
http://www.vor.ru/Spanish/new/
(e) China Radio International 
http://espanol.chinabroadcast.cn/
(f) Radio Canada International 
http://www.rcinet.ca/rci/es/
(g) IRIB (voice of the Islamic Republic of Iran)
http://spanish.irib.ir/ 

6. STATIONS IN SPANISH-SPEAKING COUNTRIES (INTERNET) 
The internet opens up dozens of possibilities for you to listen to a radio station broadcasting from the country that most interests you. Here are some websites with station listings. 

(a) Wikipedia/Spain 
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Spanish_language_radio_stations_in_Spain
(b) Si Spain 
http://www.sispain.org/english/media/radio.html#radio
(c) Zona Latina 
http://www.zonalatina.com/Radio.htm
(d) Latin World 
http://www.latinworld.com/radio/index.html
(e) Globe-Gate (scroll down to the bottom) 
http://globegate.utm.edu/spanish/span.html
(f) Latinos and Media Project 
http://www.latinosandmedia.org/media/radio.html

I hope this is useful, and that you find a radio station that suits your needs.

Good recipe for puppy chow?  CHEX MIX PUPPY CHOW   

9 cup Chex
1 cup chocolate chips
1/2 cup peanut butter
1/4 cup butter
1/4 teaspoon vanilla
1 1/2 cup powdered sugar

Put cereal in large bowl. Melt chocolate chips, peanut butter, and butter. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla.
Pour over Chex cereal, put into a large plastic bag with powdered sugar and shake well to coat.

Spread mixture evenly on wax paper and allow to cool.

Why does the Quran have so many references to the pagan mythology about the GENIE'S (JINN)? Jinn in pre-Islamic mythology:

For the ancient Semites, jinn were spirits of vanished ancient peoples who acted during the night and disappeared with the first light of dawn; they could make themselves invisible or change shape into animals at will; these spirits were commonly believed to be responsible for diseases and for the manias of some lunatics. Types of jinn include the ghul (night shade, which can change shape), the sila (which cannot change shape) and the ifrit.

The Arabs believed that the jinn were spirits of fire, although sometimes they associated them with succubi, demons in the forms of beautiful women, who visited men by night to copulate with them until they were exhausted, drawing energy from this encounter just as a vampire is supposedly sustained by his victim's blood.

Jinn in Islam: 

Muslims believe that jinn are real beings. The jinn are said to be creatures with free will, made of smokeless fire by God (the literal translation being "subtle fire" One thing I will say, is that you surely do study the Koran.  I actually enjoy reading what you post and the answers.

God the HIGHEST being, eh? Okay, if God is, and always was, the highest being ever in existance, then how is it possible? I know some think that God created everything, but if nothing can come from nothing, (rather, everything has to come from SOMEWHERE) where did God come from?

If God wasn't created by someone (something) else, then could you please, without Bible references, justify your argument? As a Hindu, the teachings are that "God" which is often refered to as Brahman is consciousness. It is the all pervading consciousness that manifested the entire universe from its very existence. It is the nothing from which everything manifests forth and it is what everything returns to (the entire universe, everything in it). Since everything came from Brahman, then everything is equal to it. That is the saying of the Upanishads "tat tvam asi" or you are that. In our own innner Self is consciousness, the atman. The atman is not seperate from Brahman. The atman is Brahman. Brahman is both everything that is manifested and yet is also everything that is unmanifested. It cannot be known with our senses, only when we search our inward can we learn to discover the Atman, and thus with Atman-Realization (Self-Realization) you are then able to achieve Brahman-Realization. Brahman is the Ultimate Reality, Supreme Soul, Cosmic Consciousness (those are how it is translated into English anyways). Everything is still Brahman, everything always will be Brahman. Everything is divine, everything is interconnected. Brahman is both impersonal and personal. Brahman is all forms, and yet also is formless. Brahman is the universe, yet also pervades it. It is the source, the root. It is time, it is space, and yet it exists without it. Hindu myths of the creation of the universe (one of the many creations of the universe, because afterall this isn't the first universe to emmanate from Brahman) sounds very much like the Big Bang. So Brahman is the source from which everything came from. It is said that this is because Brahman is overflowing with creative energy and that is Its nature. Brahman wasn't created, it is all that exists right now and yet pervades it. In Hinduism they talk about consciousness not as the byproduct of the brain, but instead say that it is the mind that is the sense organ of consciousness. The brain senses the consciousness that pervades the universe...senses Brahman...and this is what gives us awareness. Prana is the life breath, what makes some of Brahman living beings and what makes other inanimate objects, but all is still Brahman. 

Not sure if that helps. Hindus don't think of God as the "highest being", they think of God as that which exists all around them and as pure consciousness. They use forms, like the statues or pictures, to help focus their mind on God, yet these statues and pictures are merely forms for us, merely symbols and tools. Brahman is everywhere. That is why in some Hindu villages where there is no temple it is not unusual for people to simply designate a tree or rock as the "temple" place, because Brahman exists in all things. When Hindus greet each other they say "Namaste" which means "The divine in me bows and respectfully honors the divine in you." In essence, God...Brahman...is being 'worshipped' even when greeting each other. There is a saying amongst Hindus "Treat your mother like the goddess she is. Treat your father like the god he is. Treat your siblings like the divine they are. Treat you guests as you would god. For truly Brahman is everywhere." The food prayer for Hindus is "Brahman is the ritual. Brahman is the offering. Brahman is the devotee who offers to the fire which is Brahman. If a devotee sees Brahman in all things, the devotee will find Brahman."

The word Brahman comes from Sanskrit. Brih and Manah. Brih means "great", "expanding", "growing" and Manah means "consciousness". So Brahman is "Great Consciousness", "Expanding Consciousness", "Growing Consciousness"

how was muhammad ali discriminated against when he was young? for a history day project Muhammad Ali Biography

    Uploaded by Sk8erD00d (665) on Dec 12, 2004 
Cassius Marcellus Clay Jr. later known as Muhammad Ali, was a black boxer, and was proud of it. Many African Americans were ashamed of their color, but Ali was different. He was the first boxer to win the Heavyweight Championship 3 different times. He had a great personality and was liked by the people. During his life, he made big decisions that changed the course of his life completely. Muhammad Ali's journey through life was a great inspiration for African American people, but Ali himself inspires admiration to everybody.

Muhammad Ali was a man made to box. He had a great career before him since he made his first professional fight under President Eisenhower presidency. His Professional Career was really impressive. His had a great balance and was able to move his hands and feet in great speed and coordination. Ali was said to dance in the ring while destroying his opponents. Ali started fighting at a very short age, and his first teacher was Joe Martin (Hauser 18). Through hard work and discipline, he became a professional fighter and eventually the Heavyweight champion of the world. Although he lost the title twice, he regained it three times, putting him in the history books. His boxing career was put to an end when he started suffering from Parkinson's disease. This was the end of his boxing, but his greatness will never die.

Muhammad Ali was not the kind of person that gets taken away with fame and money. He is a simple, unsophisticated person with a very loving heart, and very determined (Hauser 186). He did not care much about himself, he enjoyed making people happy. While training, he let people come and see him, charging them to see the show. Doing so, he earned about $1000 a day. After the training was over, he went home and gave away every cent to needy people, especially kids (Hauser 149). This was the kind of person Ali was. His big dream was to see peace in the country, racial peace. Also, he was not totally convinced with the idea of segregation because it is not good to make people be together against their will. This way of thinking and qualities is what Malcolm X saw in Ali, and therefore thought Ali could be a great messenger for the African Americans (Hauser 110). Ali's ideas and actions distinguished him from the rest, he was an inborn leader.

During his life, Ali was forced to make some tough decisions, and always made them his own way. At the time of Ali's fighting, the United States were involved in the Vietnam War. As a result, young Americans were been drafted to serve in the military. When political figures saw Ali fighting, they decided to stop the hurting of our own and draft him, so he hurts the people in Vietnam. Ali was not pleased with this decision, because ha had just won the Heavyweight Championship and because he said, "I ain't got no quarrel with them Vietcong"(Hauser 144). His final decision on the issue was that he would not go to war. He was not willing to go and kill people, while his own are in bad conditions at home. In the same way, he was forced to decide if he wanted to become a billionaire and sell his people, or to become poor and not sell his people (185). For this rebel action, his Heavyweight Title was taken away and he was put in jail. This did not matter to him because he h!

ad followed his beliefs and obeyed Allah. He has taught his people a lesson, and that is what satisfies him. Ali's strong beliefs cut his uprising career and took away his greatest years as a person and as a boxer.

A very important quality that shapes Ali's personality is his faith in religion. Ali risked his whole career in making a choice, right or wrong. To his eyes, the correct action was to stay and face the consequences, but not go and kill innocent people. He did not agree with discrimination, and said, "People are people: God created us all." What is wrong with some form of Pascal's Wager? The only real problem I can see with Pascal's wager is that it is limited to Christianity.  However, I live a religious life (not Christian) but I am technically probably an Agnostic.  I do not KNOW 100% for sure that there is God.  But I do benefit greatly from my religious practices, and I think everyone else does to, because my practices improve my personality traits and make me a better person.  I enjoy the religious life.  It is not any kind of a burden.  It's pure joy.  

I don't say that anyone else has to follow it.  So I don't USE the "Wager" to convince anyone else that THEY should do as I do.  But for myself, what is wrong with saying, "I practice this religion, even though it may not be true, because it makes my life better, and I think it MAY be true"?  Furthermore, keep in mind that I am also certain that the other contenders - such as Islam and Christianity - are incorrect, and therefore I don't worry about going to hell for not being one of them. Let me applaud you for your open mindedness.  Many people would just blindly refuse everything religous or totally ignore it while you are prepared to adopt practices you consider benifitial even if you don't believe in the religion.

Anyhow, the problem with Pascal's Wager is one of motivation.  Is it not better to do what is considered right not because you are looking for your own benifit after death but out of care for others.  Some would say that the curse of damnation just scares people into not doing what is considered wrong.  This has happened in the past.  The threat of damnation or promise of heaven has also been taken advantage of by those who seek power.  It is also possible people may be so afraid of damnation they refuse to do any deeds in case they may be bad but in this way stop doing good deeds.

In deliverance practices, who has the right to do this? a friend of mine states that all of us has the right to do deliverance. Many non-believers take an intellectual approach at refusing the Lord's Salvation. Their rationalization that salvation is for weak minded losers who can't handle their own problems and need a crutch is a dangerous thought contrary to the Word of God.

Romans 14:11 For it is written, As I live, saith the Lord, every knee shall bow to me, and every tongue shall confess to God. 12 So then every one of us shall give account of himself to God.

An interesting part of this scripture is use of the words "every" knee and "every" tongue. The word "every" means weak minded losers and corporate presidents, academic geniuses, world leaders and mega-millionaires and anyone else drawing breath. The Word paints with a wide brush its picture of who shall give account of himself to God.

When the Apostle Paul wrote this he was not making up a story. When he said "it is written", he was quoting God. Isaiah 45:23 I have sworn by myself, the word is gone out of my mouth in righteousness, and shall not return, That unto me every knee shall bow, every tongue shall swear.

You must understand "the word is gone out of my mouth in righteousness, and shall not return," means what it says. He cannot and is not going to change his mind.

Now that we have determined salvation is not for sissies, let's get to the good part.

John 6:44 No man can come to me, except the Father which hath sent me, draw him: and I will raise him up at the last day.

You cannot be talked into making a decision for the Lord. Jesus said God will draw you. Take heed to your thoughts. Satan is pulling at you constantly with his deadly assertion that "there is not hurry. Enjoy yourself and worry about God later on." The evil one is very much involved in making sure you stay away from that Jesus stuff. 

James 4:7 Submit yourselves therefore to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you. 8 Draw nigh to God, and he will draw nigh to you.

The Lord, however, is a gentleman. He will gently nudge at your heart and allow the Holy Spirit to draw you in the right direction. It is important to yield to that that call before it is too late. When you do, good things will start to happen. Misery will turn to peace, joy will replace agony and the love of God will begin consuming your hurts.

Philippians 4:7 And the peace of God, which passeth all understanding, shall keep your hearts and minds through Christ Jesus. 

According to this scripture, there is no measure of the peace you will have. Even you will have trouble grasping it because God's peace is a peace beyond our understanding.

1 Peter 1:8 Whom having not seen, ye love; in whom, though now ye see him not, yet believing, ye rejoice with joy unspeakable and full of glory:

Just as you will be unable to understand the peace in your heart, there will be not words to describe the joy you have received. What a marvelous gift from the giver of all givers. Amazingly, it is all free. Your peace and joy was bought and paid for by Jesus Christ on a cross at Calvary.

Another reason people have refused the call of the Lord is because they think God is too loving and caring to send them to hell. They simply are missing the boat with that thinking. God never sent anyone to hell. People send themselves to hell by not accepting God's free gift of salvation.

Deuteronomy 30:19 I call heaven and earth to record this day against you, that I have set before you life and death, blessing and cursing: therefore choose life, that both thou and thy seed may live: 

The bible clearly says we have a choice. By not accepting Jesus Christ as your personal savior you are making a conscious decision to choose hell over heaven. God gives you the options and then suggests you take the "life" route. Imagine what it would be like trying to explain away that scripture when you are on the judgement seat.

God wants you just the way you are. He

Why do some see 12 year and below as sex objects? They could married to pretty women.? Some even have older girlfriends. I was messed around pretty badly by a much older guy, when I was 12. Though I know it was not my fault, I still feel that I was somehow responsible. I've never told anyone about it. I am looking for a reason, to understand and even protect the girls around me. I'm sure boys too have experienced this from other men and possibly women. So my sympathy goes out to them too. most often times when a person is sexually or physically abused a fundamental level of psycological development is missed, not fully cycled through or a person simply stops developing at that point.  Leaving them not only emotionally damaged but psychologically damaged as well.  This damage leads to a damaged idea of self as well as not only an often jaded but confused view of the world around you.  For example if a person is abused when they are preteens then developmentally they can remain there and so when they are older their mind identifies with and is attracted to people of a similar developmental stage, hence preteens... and so on... it is amazingly sad how prevalent sexual abuse is.  I once took a self development class of 88 people and out of the whole room only three had not been sexually abused.  One thing that helped me was to sit and think about and look at the even from an outside point of view and see it for what it was, with out emotion and with out blame.  I came to realize that I knew, there were several points when I knew what was happening was wrong and that it was not what I wanted and that I continued putting myself in the situation out of the desire for affection and the relationship that led to my abuse.  I realized that I had such a hunger to be loved that I was willing to put myself in a bad situation in order to get it and that was where the blame came from, I blamed myself becuase I knew and I allowed it to happen anyway.  Once I was able to sit it for what it was for me, then it was different, but I had to learn, to accept and to move on after that.

Christians...Lets remember...? Havent been on the board long this morning, but it seems to be a good board so far. So just for fun, what lead you to God?
 
Heres mine. I had never been taught about God or Jesus. When I was 13 my mom and I watched Jesus Christ Superstar, and it was the first time I really heard the story. Soon after, I started in a Private Christian school, and heard more everyday. One day, in an afternoon chapel service, I felt God calling to me, and I accepted Salvation. My mom finds it funny Jesus Christ Superstar laid the ground work for my salvation, but the Lord works in mysterious ways!

God Bless! I was raised in a Christian home.  My mom played (and still plays) the piano for church, and my dad was sometimes an interim pastor.  He was at the church we attended in South Carolina, when we were between pastors.
When I was 13, I fell away from the faith, because of my bitterness regarding my father's death three years prior, and all of the other people I had lost.
For twelve years, I wandered in darkness, even ignoring the fact that God actually spoke to me.
About three weeks ago, I recommitted my life to Christ completely.  I researched the faith, including the history of the church, and the scientific, historic, and archaelogical evidence that supports the Bible.
Surprisingly, it isn't the research that necessarily led me to God, although it did strengthen my faith.  What REALLY led me to God was the Holy Spirit...there is nothing like the feeling of the Holy Spirit filling you.

There's so many directions I could go with this...but I think I'm going to try to keep it short and sweet.  Here's the main verse:

"For the word of God is quick, and powerful, and sharper than any twoedged sword, piercing even to the dividing asunder of soul and spirit, and of the joints and marrow, and is a discerner of the thoughts and intents of the heart." (Hebrews 4:12)

The soul is our thinking, emotional self-awareness; our mind.  The Spirit is as the body is to the physical realm; it is our spiritual extension and ***what receives messages from God.***  When we are "born again" it becomes alive -- and the good news is it's perfect!  See I Peter 1:23.  So it hears from God perfectly.

The soul has a problem called the carnal mind, which is "enmity against God: for it is not subject to the law of God, neither indeed can be."  Paul right here is saying the Bible is crucial in telling the difference, able to divide between the two.

So like you said, we're dodging voices and we want Truth.  The Bible is crucial in this.

Secondly, in John chapters 14-16, he describes the Holy Ghost as the "teacher."  Understanding the scriptures properly is necessary; else we are flailing this "sword" around in the dark.  This is where prayer comes in.  Pray for God to open up His Bible to you through the Holy Spirit.  Do so in faith.  See Matthew 7:9.  

Getting to know His voice is a process and often trial and error.  Over time you recognize it and lean on it.  Let this goal be your prayer, and God will honor it!

what do you mean by the word jerk?  It is well known that the first derivative of position (symbol x) with respect to time is velocity (symbol v) and the second is acceleration (symbol a).  It is a little less well known that the third derivative, i.e. the rate of change of acceleration, is technically known as jerk (symbol j).  Jerk is a vector but may also be used loosely as a scalar quantity because there is not a separate term for the magnitude of jerk analogous to speed for magnitude of velocity.

How would I ask "Can I come Backstage?" In finnish? I'm looking into it for a fic I'm writing about this girl who gets to meet her favorite Finnish rock band, and I'm not sure how to write it. I've tried different translation sites, and they give me different answers. Anyone speak finnish that can clarify for me? Well, in proper Finnish it would be "Pääsenkö takahuoneeseen?" or a more polite "Pääsisinkö takahuoneeseen?" (= Could I come backstage?), but nobody really uses the word "takahuone", especially if you're a rock star or a fan of one. Usually we simply use the word "backstage".

So I'd rather say "Pääsisinkö backstagelle?" or "Pääsiskö backstagelle?". The latter one is what I would use in a situation like that.

I hope this helps.

what was the condition of the catholic church in 1500?  1500 was right before the start of the Protestant reformation.  Martin Luther's 95 Theses were written in 1517.

There were a couple of specific issues facing the church that started this process.  The first would have been the sale of indulgences, specifically by John Tetzel. Wikipedia has a great definition of indulgences:  "An indulgence is the remission (either full or partial) of temporal punishment still remaining for sins after their guilt has already been removed by absolution."  Someone could purchase an indulgence for himself or for someone else.  The church was using indulgences as a way of raising funds to build St. Peter's in Rome.

Simony was another issue facing the church.  Simony can be defined as the sale and purchase of church positions such as priests.  This led to unqualified people having positions as both priests and bishops.  Remember, the mass was read in Latin, however many priests at the time did not know Latin, and were just speaking gibberish.  The practice of simony also led to the sale of indulgences as a way of paying back the pope back for a position.  The pope would issue an indulgence for the priest to sell, but the pope not only received the payment for the position, he also got a percentage of the indulgence.

The church was in a mess.  There were many in the Catholic Church who knew it needed to be reformed.

If races evolved because of natural selection, isn't it the case that:

Some populations that have never had a written language will have less developed brains to handle it.

Some populations that recently lived in a tribal environemnt have developed instincts that are better suited to that?

Some populations would be poorly adapted to modern life and would resort to stealing and crime to survive.

can your best friend start actin weird wen u lose weight & look a bit better than her ? am very confused as y? i hav worked very hard to look beautiful over the yrs and now finally after losng a lot of weight i am being treated nicely by everybody except her. i  m  thinkin maybe she doesnt like the new me. First I want to say.....WAY TO GO!!!
It's very hard to lose weight, you should be very proud of yourself!
Sometimes when a person loses weight they gain a lot of attention they never had before. Sometimes the person who loses weight gains more self-respect and pride. Sometimes when someone loses weight, their attitude and demeanor changes. Some people feel threatened when someone they know has gone through a major weight change, whether they gain or lose weight. Sounds like your friend feels threatened by the change in you, whether it is your weight or maybe your attitude has changed....maybe you are too confident and they feel less important to you.
And maybe, she's just jealous of the fact that you have changed and she isn't getting the same attention as you. If that's the case, there really isn't anything you can do to make her feel better about herself.
Talk to her about it, ask her what's bothering her. If you find out that she is envious of the new you, you have to decide whether you want to keep the friendship and work on it, or let her go her own way if there doesn't seem to be a solution.
Good luck!

Did the great flood actually happen or is it a myth? Because, wouldn't all the stuff about Big Adam and Eve, Holy Moses, Abe and Ike and all the earlier myths have been destroyed? 

Was the 10 commandments on the boat too? 

Did he get all species of animals?

You know like the Asian Elephant and the African Grey Elephant??

The White Tiger, Bengal Tiger, and the Siberian Tiger?

The Red Panda anf the Black Panda?

And if he only got 2 of each why did he kill one of each to thank Ole God for not killing him??

I mean why would a burnt chipmunk be of any use to Jehova hany how? No.  There isn't the slightest scrap of evidence that a worldwide flood occurred.  Nor is there any possible physical way to construct a wooden vessel the size described by the Bible without it cracking apart under its own mass in the water.  Nor is there any reaonably possible way for such a vessel to be ventilated by a single tiny window.  Or even have enough for two--or seven--of every species in the world.  Or an even remotely believeable method for a handful of people to actually be able to take care of all the animals aboard the Ark for nearly a year.  

Not to mention the many ancient civilizations like the Chinese and the Summerians who somehow managed to keep right of going and not even notice their own desrtruction.

The more you look closely at the tale, the more "Godmagic" you have to invoke in your effort to explain away the real-world problems of the story.  Since there's no such thing as magic, it's safe to chaulk the entire story as fiction.  A secondary creationist tale.

BTW:  Yes, there are many civilizations that have tales of floods.  Floods were a near-universal experience for our ancestors, so naturally they would be incorperated into mythologies.  What the Creationists convienently overlook is the wide variety of differences between all the flood stories...the number of survivors ranges from two to entire tribes, the details of the source of the floods and the motives of the gods that cause them are all different, etc...  The only commonality of the tales is the involvment of a lot of water.

did thanksgiving originate in the U.S. or brought over from Europe?  Although there is record of earlier thanksgiving celebrations (most notably in 1619 at Berkeley Plantation, Virginia), Americans trace their traditional Thanksgiving holiday to one celebrated in 1621. This celebration was held at the Plymouth Colony, now in the state of Massachusetts. The English Pilgrims who had founded the colony marked the occasion by feasting with Native American guests—members of the Wampanoag tribe—who brought gifts of food as a gesture of goodwill. Although this event was an important part of American colonial history, there is no evidence that any of the participants thought of the feast as a thanksgiving celebration. Two years later, during a period of drought, a day of fasting and prayer was changed to one of thanksgiving because rains came during the prayers. Gradually the custom prevailed among New Englanders to annually celebrate Thanksgiving after the harvest.

Colonial governments and, later, state governments took up the Puritan custom of designating thanksgiving days to commemorate various public events. Gradually the tradition of holding annual thanksgiving holidays spread throughout New England and into other states. During the American Revolution (1775-1783) the Continental Congress proclaimed a national day of thanksgiving following the American victory at the Battle of Saratoga in 1777. U.S. president George Washington proclaimed another day of thanksgiving in 1789 in honor of the ratification of the Constitution of the United States. In 1817 New York State adopted Thanksgiving Day as an annual custom, and many other states soon did the same. Most of the state celebrations were held in November, but not always on the same day.

In the mid-19th century Sarah Josepha Hale, editor of Godey’s Ladies Book, led a movement to establish Thanksgiving as a national holiday. In 1863, during the American Civil War (1861-1865), President Abraham Lincoln proclaimed the last Thursday in November to be Thanksgiving Day in order to bolster the Union’s morale. After the war, Congress established Thanksgiving as a national holiday, but widespread national observance caught on only gradually. Many Southerners saw the new holiday as an attempt to impose Northern customs on them. However, in the late 19th century Thanksgiving’s emphasis on home and family appealed to many people throughout the United States. As a distinctly American holiday, Thanksgiving was also considered an introduction to American values for the millions of immigrants then entering the country.

If Adam & Eve were the first 2 people on Earth....? Does that mean mankind grew out of incest commited by their offspring? I believe that a literal interpretation of Genesis is ignorant.  I believe that Genesis is a Christian mythology and I have scholars on my side.  The whole creation story is symbolic.  When it was written, we didn't have science to explain how the earth or its inhabitants were created, so the writer had to explain it in a way that people living at the time would understand.  The Adam and Eve story, I believe is symbolic of emerging societies.  Adam and Eve living in paradise are symbolic to small nomadic groups of people living apart from each other.  They are kicked out of paradise when nomadic groups began to experience conditions that threatened their survival - hot sun, cold winters and learned about the fragility of life and death.  They had two children, Cain and Able - this symbolizes the population getting larger and when Cain killed Able, this is symbolic for fighting and wars between individuals and groups of people with differing ideas.

religiously speaking, what is the difference between sunni and shi'ite? ? The division happened after Muhammad's death.

17 The prophet’s death provoked a crisis. He died without any male progeny and without a clearly designated successor. As Philip Hitti states: “The caliphate [office of caliph] is therefore the oldest problem Islam had to face. It is still a living issue. . . . In the words of Muslim historian al-Shahrastani [1086-1153]: ‘Never was there an Islamic issue which brought about more bloodshed than the caliphate (imamah).’” How was the problem solved back there in 632 C.E.? “Abu-Bakr . . . was designated (June 8, 632) Muhammad’s successor by some form of election in which those leaders present at the capital, al-Madinah, took part.”—History of the Arabs.

18 The successor to the prophet would be a ruler, a khalifah, or caliph. However, the question of the true successors to Muhammad became a cause for divisions in the ranks of Islam. The Sunni Muslims accept the principle of elective office rather than blood descent from the prophet. Therefore they believe that the first three caliphs, Abu Bakr (Muhammad’s father-in-law), `Umar (the prophet’s adviser), and `Uthman (the prophet’s son-in-law), were the legitimate successors to Muhammad.

19 That claim is contested by the Shi`ite Muslims, who say that the true leadership comes through the prophet’s blood line and through his cousin and son-in-law, `Ali ibn Abi Talib, the first imam (leader and successor), who married Muhammad’s favorite daughter, Fatimah. Their marriage produced Muhammad’s grandsons Hasan and Husayn. The Shi`ites also claim “that from the beginning Allah and His Prophet had clearly designated `Ali as the only legitimate successor but that the first three caliphs had cheated him out of his rightful office.” (History of the Arabs) Of course, the Sunni Muslims view that differently.

20 What happened to `Ali? During his rule as the fourth caliph (656-661 C.E.), a struggle over leadership arose between him and the governor of Syria, Mu`awiyah. They joined battle, and then to spare further Muslim bloodshed, they threw their dispute open to arbitration. `Ali’s acceptance of arbitration weakened his case and alienated many of his followers, including the Khawarij (Seceders), who became his deadly foes. In the year 661 C.E., `Ali was murdered with a poisoned sabre by a Khariji zealot. The two groups (the Sunni and the Shi`ah) were at loggerheads. The Sunni branch of Islam then chose a leader from the Umayyads, wealthy Meccan chiefs, who were outside of the prophet’s family.

21 For the Shi`ah, `Ali’s firstborn, Hasan, the prophet’s grandson, was the true successor. However, he resigned and was murdered. His brother Husayn became the new imam, but he too was killed, by Umayyad troops on October 10, 680 C.E. His death or martyrdom, as the Shi`ah view it, has had a significant effect on the Shi`at `Ali, the party of `Ali, down to this day. They believe that `Ali was the true successor to Muhammad and the first “imam [leader] divinely protected against error and sin.” `Ali and his successors were considered by the Shi`ah to be infallible teachers with “the divine gift of impeccability.” The largest segment of the Shi`ah believe that there have been only 12 true imams, and the last of these, Muhammad al-Muntazar, disappeared (878 C.E.) “in the cave of the great mosque at Samarra without leaving offspring.” Thus “he became ‘the hidden (mustatir)’ or ‘the expected (muntazar) imam.’ . . . In due time he will appear as the Mahdi (divinely guided one) to restore true Islam, conquer the whole world and usher in a short millennium before the end of all things.”—History of the Arabs.

I am a Christian and Spiritually oriented person.  My path is alive through "tight" relationships with both the Holy Spirit and Jesus.  Many do not know. . ., but Jesus and the Holy Spirit can and DO teach something non-traditional religions have named Transcendence.

Will you bear with me, if I expand a picture for you to look upon and possibly contemplate?

The Crucifixion is looked upon as physical torture - to the degree that we have to turn away, and hold on to ourselves.  Many learn to love Him by witnessing the pain aspect.  Some love Him without dwelling upon it.  The meaning of the Crucifixion is far greater than the seeming display of physical vulnerability and pain:  Our vulnerability to each other and to our bodies.

The Crucifixion was undertaken by Him as the greatest learning tool He could use and teach by.  After the people saw  the ultimate physical abuse taking place - to an extent that leads to death - He then offered the Final Statement:  What God Created. . . cannot be destroyed.  The physical is perishable, but not what God Created.  Notice. . .He reappeared in his physical image again, and remained in it until He desired to leave.  Note:  The physical image he appeared in contained a "hole" for the others to see, but the blood, the bruising, the torn and tattered flesh were all absent !

Inside of us, and coupled with our human Intellect is a thing called soul or spirit.  Jesus and the Holy Spirit teach how to live through that - more than through the logic of the Intellect.  They both SERVE us in this physical life - the Intellect and the Soul.

Jesus can also TEACH how to use our God-given soul or Spirit-Mind to block out or transcend the pains of the physical.  He willingly teaches that WE ARE NOT VULNERABLE ;  to each other, or to the human Intellect !  Not all of us become Masters as He did and master life.  But, Jesus can teach level upon level of God's Thoughts and Knowledge to us - IF we choose to learn it, and ask for that.  

Presently, I am working on that very thing.  Transcendence and Detachment.  To do this, you must have something to "go up against."  Something to test against.  I have experienced the inflictions of physical pain - and, according to His instruction, through my Mind, have learned to "banish" it.  Many, many of us have learned this.  Ghandi spoke of the horrifying beatings he received at the hands of his opposers.  He was taken to the hospital more than once so bruised, bloodied and purpled that it was not understood how he bore the pain.  He said, that although the body showed the infliction - he did not FEEL it !  We have no idea how powerful our souls or spirit-minds are.  And the joy of tapping into its power.  Many non-notable people, as you have mentioned, and now me too (!) have experienced the gifts of Spirit and some degree of Mastery over the physical.  It's real.

When we are taught that after Ascension Jesus rose to rest and sit at the right hand of God and is no longer teaching on earth - we should be aware that there is a slight mis-perception in that.  He DID go before our Creator.  He was allowed to "speak" with Him.  But, He was quickly placed in charge of the Sonship and ceaselessly and intensely teaches us through Mind-to-Mind.  We receive His tutoring when we invite Him and then learn to hear his voice through our mind.  

The Sons of Man (Us) are much more. . .than we appear to be.  Something else Created our Minds.

Best regards, Lana

does the cathlic church still offer sanctuary?  Yes they do.  All throughout history the Catholic Church has been a place of refuge for those seeking shelter.  In World War Two the Catholic Church offered sanctuary to the Jews escaping nazi persecution and in Poland under Nazi and then communist control. More recently Manuel Noriega comes to mind. Today in Africa many people suffering persecution are taking refuge in catholic churches as we speak.

Sanctuary is not just a Christian principle or even a Catholic one. 

It has been offered by many other religions, including temples of Osiris in Egypt, and certain Greek temples like the Temple of Apollo. Sanctuary was only good so long as they remained in the church. If they were to ever leave the church, the authorities would grab them. Originally, some people who used sanctuary would then join the church, and stay cloistered within it. To do otherwise would mean capture by the authorities. 

Today it is not "officially" recognized, but there is still a respect for the church and religious buildings, and storming these buildings is really considered by most people and authorities, Verboten (Forbidden).  The public backlash would be tantamount to political suicide.

What's a heterosexual? anyone? Heterosexuality primarily refers to aesthetic, sexual and romantic attraction exclusively between two individuals of differing genders. It is characterised as a sexual orientation, contrasted with homosexuality and bisexuality. The concept has its roots in the 19th century tradition of personality taxonomy.

comes from the Greek word heteros, meaning "different" (for other uses, see heterozygote, heterogeneous), and the Latin for sex (that is, characteristic sex or sexual differentiation). The term "heterosexual" was coined shortly after and opposite to the word "homosexual" by Karl Maria Kertbeny in 1868 and was first published in 1869. "Heterosexual" was first listed in Merriam-Webster's New International Dictionary as a medical term for "morbid sexual passion for one of the opposite sex", but in 1934 in their Second Edition Unabridged it is a "manifestation of sexual passion for one of the opposite sex; normal sexuality". (Katz, 1995)

Heterosexuality, like any forms of identity is very subjective. In western society, one is generally thought of as heterosexual if one derives either all, or the vast majority of their erotic and/or sexual stimulation from people of the different sex to them. In other cultures a heterosexual man may engage in homosexual intercourse provided that he keeps the role traditionally assigned to his sex during intercourse and his gender during the surrounding relationship. Also, in some cultures a heterosexually identifying man may assume any role during homosexual congress as a social action provided he maintain a relationship with a woman in his family life. Cultural allowances such as this have been historically rarer amongst women, but more recently have been tolerated more than the male equivalents largely because of its connection to some schools of feminism.

Definitions of sexuality tend to be narrower to most heterosexuals than it is to people of other sexual orientations. In most cases a potential partner's sex is determined wholly by anatomic sex at birth and genetic sex. Many heterosexuals would argue that one whose determination of a partner's sex deviates from that criterion cannot truly be heterosexual. Transgendered people and even those with many natural intersex conditions are very rarely seen as potential mates by heterosexuals, even those who consider themselves tolerant and accepting to such identities.

History and demographics

The prevalence of exclusive heterosexuality has varied over the centuries and also from culture to culture.
Though there have always been individuals (sometimes in a majority, sometimes in a minority) who were exclusively attracted to those of the opposite sex, heterosexuality as an identity (just like homosexuality) has developed only since the middle of the nineteenth century.

The history of heterosexuality is part of the history of sexuality. That history and science derivative of it is far from complete. Owing to complications of human politics and prejudice, coupled with the malleable nature of human behaviour, it will be some time before the history and nature of all forms of human sexual behaviour are truly known.

Psychological factors relating to sexuality
A broad array of opinion holds that much human behavior ultimately is explainable in terms of natural selection. From this point of view, the shifting social balance between heterosexual and homosexual desire has evolved as a fitter survival strategy for the species than either an exclusively heterosexual or homosexual configuration of desire.

In traditional societies individuals are often under heavy social pressure to marry and have children, irrespective of their sexual orientation. In modern society, many homosexual people who wish to have children have found a way to satisfy their nurturing instincts, either through fostering or adopting children, or through artificial or natural insemination.

Help with an English to Latin translation? I am translating LOVE THE LIFE THAT YOU LIVE to latin

So far I got DILECTIO VESTRI VITA ILLUM VOS VIVO

I believe that this translates out to Love your life that you to live.  However I am not sure that my masculin or feminin tenses are correct. Can someone who knows latin please help? No, that's not correct.  Illum is "that thing," which is not the function of "that" in your sentence.  Furthermore, "Dilectio" is not the correct form of the verb (you need a command), and is more "choose" or "pick," rather than "love."

I'd guess it's something like:

Ama vitam quam vivis. 

Plural would be:

Amate vitas quam vivitis.  - Love the lives that you live.  This doesn't sound quite correct; I'd probably say: Amate vitam quam vivitis.

EDIT: Spelling mistake on vivis (originally wrote vives; contamination from Spanish).

what are Egypt mummies??  A mummy is the body of a person (or an animal) that has been preserved after death. Normally when we die, bacteria and other germs eat away at the soft tissues (such as skin and muscles) leaving only the bones behind. Since bacteria need water in order to grow, mummification usually happens if the body dries out quickly after death. The body may then be so well preserved that we can even tell how the dead person may have looked in life.

Mummies are made naturally or by embalming, which is any process that people use to help preserve a dead body. Mummies can be dried out by extreme cold, by the sun, by smoke, or using chemicals such as natron. Some bodies become mummies because there were favorable natural conditions when they died. Others were preserved and buried with great care.

The ancient Egyptians believed that mummifying a person's body after death was essential to ensure a safe passage to the afterlife.

Which is better, to do the right thing for the wrong reason, or the wrong thing for the right reason?  That is a thought-provoking question.  The answer necessarily pivots on the definition of right and wrong.  Who determines the standard?  The laws of a certain land may say this particular act is right – acceptable.  A higher authority (if one accepts such) may say it is wrong.  Without ascertaining who sets the standard, there is no frame of reference within which to respond to the question.\n\nMoreover, if one were to say it is alright to do the wrong thing for the right reason, the implication is that sincerity and heart-felt motive outweigh the standard.  But is that really so?  It all points back to the standard - there must be a standard first and the one who sets the standard must have the authority to do so and the ability to enforce it.  Else, the question, in effect, becomes meaningless.

What (or how) is the fastest way to learn how to speak Mandarin Chinese?  It is possible to teach yourself, believe it or not. I started out with 'Modern Chinese: A Basic Course' by The Faculty of Peking University. It's put out by Dover and has a CD with native speakers, both male and female, to accompany the text. Quite old, so kind of 'communist', but describes the sound system in detail, gives you a good foundation for the grammar - the basic sentence patterns.

And a nice book on the writing system: Teach Yourself Beginner's Chinese Script, put out by Teach Yourself Books.

Later on, I found a very nice (and free!) course on the Internet. Here's the URL: www.hanyu.com.cn/en/default.asp

This will give you more modern vocabulary, how to use it in conversation.

Also if you want you can learn Chinese characters, they have very nice animations which slowly take you through each character, like an invisible hand drawing them for you so you know the order and direction of the strokes (every detail IS important - if you don't get it right and you learn with the wrong order or direction, it'll come back to haunt you when you are writing the characters fast and they just 'don't look Chinese'...).

I believe they also have a Japanese and a Korean version of this site - don't have the URL for it handy.

Finally, a nice dictionary for beginners: Oxford Starter Chinese Dictionary.

You may be interested to know - or you may already know - God has destroyed relatively large groups of people in the past who were involved in wicked things such as child sacrifice (as in the case of the Canaanites), debased sexual wrongs (as in the case of Sodom and Gomorrah) and extreme violence and physical abuse (as in the case of the flood) among other things.

It certainly is unfair that righteous, meek people must be constantly affected by people who choose to ruin themselves, others and this planet.  But the Bible, at Revelation 11:18, explains that God will soon "bring to ruin those ruining the earth."

Psalm 37:10, 11, 29 says, "And just a little while longer and the wicked will be no more; and you will certainly give attention to his place and he will not be.  But the meek ones themselves will possess the earth and they will find exquisite delight in the abundance of peace...The righteous themselves will possess the earth and they will reside forever upon it."

Just how many people on the earth today are "wicked" and how many are "righteous?"  We cannot know the number or the percentage precisely, but the Bible makes it clear that the majority of mankind is on the "wide and spacious road leading to destruction" and very few are on the "narrow and cramped road leading to life." (Matthew 7:13)

However, you can gain a lot of peace by adopting God's view of the situation.  Though he will do what is necessary to clean up the earth and make life worth living for those who are willing to meet his requirements, "Jehovah is not slow respecting his promise, as some people consider slowness, but he is patient with you because he does not wish any to be destroyed, but desires all to attain to repentance." (2 Peter 3:9)

If you look at people causing you hardship or pain of any kind as people who potentially will eventually see the light of truth and make changes for the better, just like Saul who later became known as the Apostle Paul, you will find greater joy in life now.

I highly recommend you get yourself a copy of the book called What Does the Bible Really Teach?  I'm sure it will help you deal with troubling situations and so far unanswered questions or unsatisfying answers you've received elsewhere.

I wish you well!

why did Mohammad of Islam need 9 wives when he preaches to muslims to have only 4 wives?  I did not intend to answer this question if someone had already given a satisfying answer.‎

First, I have to admire you for the excellent question since it is a misconception that ‎many non-Muslims carry about Islam.‎

Now, you question uses the word "need" rather than "had". That would make a difference ‎in the answer.‎

If you indeed meant "need", you first need to know few facts. The Prophet Mohammad ‎‎(peace be upon him) first married at the age of 25 a woman that is 15 years older than ‎him. His first wife was married twice and had children from her ex-husbands. His ‎marriage lasted until he turned 50 when his wife died. He stayed two years before ‎marrying an 80 year old woman. So, the Prophet lived 52 years and married only one woman. The Prophet ‎died at the age of 63; by that time, he had nine wives. The Prophet had several wives for ‎several reasons; one reason was to build a solid political relation with other tribes or ‎nations (do you know that one of the Prophet's wives was a Christian and another was ‎Jewish?); another reason was to build a social bond with his followers by marrying their ‎sisters or daughters; another important reason was for his wives to convey all the ‎important lessons of building a family to a nation that reached a population of 2 billion; ‎he could not have done all of this with one wife.‎

However, if you meant, "why did Mohammad of Islam had 9 wives ...", then the ‎referenced source below will give you the answer. The translation of the verse in English ‎states:‎

‎"It is not lawful for thee to marry more women after this, nor to change them for other ‎wives, even though their beauty attract thee, except any thy right hand should possess as ‎hand-maidens: and Allah doth watch over all things."‎

It might be difficult for you to comprehend the meaning of the above verse, but to ‎understand it better, you should know that the Qur'an (the words of God) was revealed to ‎the Prophet (pbuh) by Gabriel on a span of 23 years. By the ‎time the translated verse above was revealed, the Prophet (pbuh) had nine wives. God ‎‎(Allah) advised the Prophet (pbuh) on this verse that he should not marry more women or ‎even divorce one with the intention of marrying a more beautiful woman.‎

Now, you might ask, "when the verse was revealed to him, why then he did not divorce five to satisfy this verse?" That would ‎also be a good question. To answer this, you should understand that divorce is the last ‎solution in Islam to end a bad marriage; why then divorce if the marriage was a good ‎one? The Prophet Mohammad (pbuh) had a model marriage with his wives.‎

Let me explain this from a different perspective with a similar case that comes to mind. I ‎heard that the Chinese Government restricts the people of China from having more than a ‎certain number of children (I do not know if this is still true). Now imagine that you are a ‎Chinese with nine obedient and loving children, then this rule was enforced for the first ‎time so that you should not have more than four children; would you kill the other five ‎just to satisfy your government regulation?‎

Don't people talking on cellphones in public place realize they are being rude?? I seriously can not beleive how rude some people are about talking on their cellphones. They take them into public places like malls or grocery stores or movie theatres and just loudly talk away, not seeming to realize how much they are annoying other people. Worst of all are those stupid headsets, so people can walk around loudly talking to nobody about personal things no one wants to hear about.

And like when I'm cahsiering at work, sometimes people will come up to me and have me ring up their sale... WHILE they are talking to somone on their cellphone. And when I try to ask them a question about their purchase, they'll just look at me like, "What? Can't you see I'm on the phone here??"

Seriously, what is people's problems? Can't they see they are being rude? Or do they just not care? I don't know what some people's problem is!  At the last college I went to, there was this guy (40-something years old) that was ALWAYS on his phone in the hallway or the courtyard or the cafeteria.  And he would always be talking incredibly loudly, so you were pretty much forced to listen to his conversation, and a lot of them were inappropriate.  I finally walked up to him and told him off after he was outside one day talking (more like shouting, actually) about some co-worker of his who had a pelvic exam and all her gynecological problems... and used her first and last name and phone number. I told him that I didn't know who that lady was, but I was pretty sure she didn't want me and the rest of the world knowing about all her personal business.  And the guy just kind of shrugged and went on his way, and told whoever he was talking to about how some "little girl"(me) was trying to teach him manners!
And BlueTooth/handsfree users can be so obnoxious too!  Especially the ones who have super tiny headsets and look toward you while saying something like "Hi! How are you?" and then get annoyed when you respond!  
I totally understand that people like having cell phones, I use mine pretty frequently, but I wish they would keep in mind that they are still in public, and they need to be polite to the people around them.

If a person existed BEFORE Christ and at a time when the belief in ONE god did not exist, would he go to hell? There are millions of people that were born BEFORE Jesus existed. Also, monotheism did not exist for a long time and even when a belief in one God did exist it was eclipsed by polytheism. So according to scripture, are all of these people damned to hell? They had no way of knowing that a belief in Christ was the only path to heaven. They did not even have a concept of monotheism (one god). Read Dante's Divine Comedy, particularly the first book, Inferno, and the last, Paradisio.  Some of them, who did God's will, were admitted to heaven after Christ's death; others, who were not particularly evil or sinful, wound up in the highest (least punishing) level of hell, sometimes called limbo.

Mature and educated answers only!? There are so may so-called" psychics" out there and that a lot of money is made from it. A majority of it is quack (i.e. lottery numbers).  However, I do have a couple of questions that would put me at ease:  
1.Is there a such thing have having that "ability" of having that 6th sense? 
2. Who does one go to to determine or "diagnose" that one has that "gift" or "ability"? 
3..How do people who truly get posses that talent, put it to "proper" use?

*Since my late teens, I have occasional dreams or visions in which many events happened accurately.  Lately, I have been more dreams and experiences and certain events have happended weeks or months later. There is no such thing as a "psychic ability". These incidents come in two kinds: (1) deliberate scams, and (2) people who are sufficiently unaware of the world around them that they honestly believe that they have powers. 

If you would like to diagnose your ability, you should contact James Randi (you can google him), and have him set up a test. He will set up a situation that will demonstrate that you do not have the powers you might think that you have. 

Your dream experiences do not imply any special ability.

I need specific differences between Venezuelan Spanish in comparison to Latin American Spanish? In terms of linguistical differences, or differences in the dialects. Why to people from some countries speak foreign languages better than people from other countries? I know the reason why native English language speakers don't speak languages well (well i've got a pretty good idea)!

But what about other countries.... Q: What do you call someone who speaks two languages?
A: Bilingual.

Q: What do you call someone who speak one language?
A: American.

In many parts of the world, it's common to speak two or three languages.  Many places speak a European language as a second to their own, or a "lingua franca" for their region, such as Arabic (you can hear it from Morocco to Afghanistan) or Swahili (20+ African countries and 50+ million people).  

The Europeans, North Africans and Middle Easterners speak several languages because they are exposed to them regularly.  You'll find many Scandinavian and Baltic (Estonian, Latvian and Lithuanian) athletes who compete at the world level speak English because they receive English TV transmissions.  (The Baltic states listened to Finnish transmissions illegally.  The Finns didn't mind, but Moscow did!)

Fortunately, most who do listen to English broadcasts listen to BBC, and NOT to Mouthpiece of America - oops, Voice - VOA.  Sad to say, it's the English speakers who are the biggest morons and don't speak more than our own tongue.  Not taking my French classes seriously in elementary and high school was the second biggest mistake of my life.  (Listening to my parents was #1.)

And to see idiot reichwingers in the US who think Americans speaking Spanish is a problem, I can only shake my head.  South America is 500+ million in size, is a growing economic power, they speak Spanish (except for Brazil), and the US wants to ban Spanish in schools and government.  Incredible. 9_9

How do you get to level 2?  To reach level 2 you must have 250 total points. If you drop below that you will again be on level one. You may answer and vote on 20 questions a day giving you 2 points and 1 point respectively. Once you reach level 2 you will be able to rate others with a thumbs up or down but you will receive no points for that. You will get nothing but your own satisfaction for reaching the next level and helping others in the process.

The link will explain the point system to you.

http://answers.yahoo.com/info/scoring_sy...

The way I figure it, if you answer and vote on the Max number of questions you can it will take...

2 days to get to level 2
8 days to get to level 3
8 days to get to level 4
3 weeks to get to level 5
40 days to get to level 6 if you only answer and vote on 50 questions (remember that's 2 points and 1 point respectively, so mix it up however you want)
4 months to get to level 7 (if you follow the above 50 question rule)

Then of course you need to eliminate the top leaders if they keep going like they are. (20,000 points per week, sheesh)

Good Luck!

When was the first Valentine held? From where the word derived? And how did it come about? Where was it held?  History
[edit]

February fertility festivals

The association of the middle of February with love and fertility dates to ancient times. In the calendar of Ancient Athens, the period between mid January and mid February was the month of Gamelion, which was dedicated to the sacred marriage of Zeus and Hera.

In Ancient Rome, the day of February 15 was Lupercalia, the festival of Lupercus, the god of fertility, who was represented by two half-naked young men, dressed in goat skins. As part of the purification ritual, the priests of Lupercus would sacrifice goats to the god, and after drinking wine, they chose two young men to run through the streets of Rome holding pieces of the goat skin above their heads, striking anyone they met with the goat hide. Young women especially would come forth voluntarily for the occasion, in the belief that being so touched would render them fruitful and bring easy childbirth.

According to the Catholic Encyclopedia (1908), at least three different Saint Valentines, all of them martyrs and all quite obscure, are mentioned in the early martyrologies under the date of February 14:

    * a priest in Rome who suffered martyrdom in the second half of the 3rd century and was buried on the Via Flaminia.
    * a bishop of Interamna (modern Terni) also suffered martyrdom in the second half of the 3rd century and was also buried on the Via Flaminia, but in a different location than the priest.
    * a martyr in North Africa, about whom little else is known.

The connection between St. Valentine and romantic love is not mentioned in any early histories and is regarded by secular historians as purely a matter of legend (see below). The feast of St. Valentine was first declared to be on February 14 by Pope Gelasius I in 496. There is a widespread legend that he created the day to counter the practice held on Lupercalia of young men and women pairing off as lovers by drawing their names out of an urn, but this practice is not attested in any sources from that era.

In the 19th century, relics of St. Valentine were donated by Pope Gregory XVI to the Whitefriar Street Carmelite Church in Dublin, Ireland, which has become a popular place of pilgrimage on February 14.

In 1969, as part of a larger effort to pare down the number of saint days of purely legendary origin, the Church removed St. Valentine's Day as an official holiday from its calendar

What exactly is the context of the Bible? I keep hearing about how it's easy to take verses out of context. What I don't understand, is what context these verses are supposed to be in. For example, Psalm 137:9 reads, "Happy shall he be, who takes and dashes your little ones against the rock."

Now, I know I'm taking it out of context. Now it's the last verse in that chapter, and the ones before it read, "Remember, Yahweh, against the children of Edom, the day of Jerusalem; who said, 'Raze it! Raze it even to its foundation!' Daughter of Babylon, doomed to destruction, he will be happy who rewards you, as you have served us."

Do we only bash little ones upon the rock if we're razing a city? Can someone explain the context to me please? The context has two elements (at least)

a) The temporal and spatial time of its writing.
b) The large body of words/verses which define and are defined by it.
In this case, the jews have suffered a humiliating, devasting loss. Part of their grief is expressed in highly charged, emotional curses. You see much of this in Mid-East funerals today where guns are fired and eternal vengeance is vowed. This not a prescriptive passage, but a descriptive one of sorrow/rage. 
You are right to ask about contest.

Who here loves 1st Samuel 15:3?? "Now go and smite non-believers, and utterly destroy all that they have, and spare them not; but slay both man and woman, infant and suckling."

Is this how we know God really loves us? Nice try, but what you're trying won't work. God said AMALEKITES for a reason. God told Saul to smite the AMALEKITES in particular for a reason. Before you talk about I Samuel 15:3, why don't you read I Samuel 15:2? In this verse, God says that he remembers a transgression that the Amalekites had committed against the Israelites; right after their liberation from Egypt, they had lain in wait for them. The Amalekites had also slain many of the Israelites, though that was, in part, due to God's punishment. Because the Amalekites lay in wait to harm Israel, God had to fulfill the promise to Abraham that he would bless his children (the Israelites) who blessed them, but would also curse those who cursed them. Therefore, God was delivering his punishment for the Amalekites harming Israel. This is why God orders the utter destruction of the people; it is retribution fot an offense committed against Israel a long time ago.
This Bible verse in no way compares to the Quran. God never orders the Israelites to slay them in order to spread religion, as Muhammad had done (which is justified by the Quran). God had done it as punishment, not as a way to spread religion. Your replacement of Amalekites with non-believers gives the reader the impression that that verse of the Bible promotes murder for the spread of Judaism and/or Christianity, which is not the case. Your use of the phrase "non-believers" as opposed to "the non-believers" also makes the Bible verse seem to say that the Israelites are allowed to kill for the spread of their religion whenever they think that it is necessary, which is, once again, not the case. Please stop tampering with God's word and let the people read exactly what the Bible says. 

By the way, I love I Samuel 15:3. It shows how God exacts justice upon those that rebel against him. It also shows that God never forgets an unforgiven offense and reinforces the truth that, though one may get by with sin, one cannot get away with it.

Does anyone think there's any hope for Cajun culture and language? I'm Cajun, and I was raised with only a handful of Cajun words and phrases in my vocabulary.  The only people I know who actually speak Cajun French are over 65.  And none of the young people are interested. Does anyone have a more optimistic view? Is the Cajun culture going to end up a small paragraph in a text book that noone cares about? Before the Europeans arrived in what is now called North America, there were a number of indigenous peoples scattered over the land.  In the last three hundred and fifty years, many have been reduced to less than one hundred who speak their original tongue and some have become extinct, with little or no record.

To keep a culture alive. Get it recorded. Visit those old Cajuns with a recorder.  Ask questions, get them to tell stories.  Keeps notes on your work.  Who knows, in 1000 years someone will have wish that this was done now.

If you need help, get help.  The best I can do is prepare my gumbo with sassafras and crawdad.

The Simplicity of Existence - Or is it? Imagine a void universe -- nothing but empty space reaching out forever. And pretend that only you are in it. Place something into your imagined universe -- something simple such as a steel ball. This is easy to imagine, but if you had to make this item to get it into your universe, where would you get the materials for it? Could you just pop them into being? The creation of something from nothing can happen in one's mind, but can it happen really? The most simple and logical explanation, based on all currently available evidence, is that the universe has always existed in some form.

And, it is only logical to conclude there are other universes, as well.

There is no logical reason whatsoever to invoke magic or invent a non-existent "creation" when there is no evidence or reason to support such an idea.

whats inri stand for on the cross?  IESVS NAZARENVS REX IVDAEORVM

Since anyone who would actually see the paintings of the Crucifixion in the Middle Ages (inside a Church) would then already be familiar with the phrase (in Latin), the painters all apparently chose to simplify their paintings by only including the initials of the four Latin words, I N R I. The early Church had also apparently used that abbreviation.

Luke 23:38 also mentions the sign on the Cross, and he mentions that the sign was written in three languages, Greek, Latin and Hebrew. Scholars then chose to follow the wording presented in John, as it is more complete by including the reference to Nazareth, and as it might be presenting the Latin version of the text on the Cross. In all three languages the first word was Jesus, but since Greek and Hebrew don't use the letter J, His Name was spelled beginning with an I. The Roman (Latin) spelling followed that, (IESVS) even though their language included a J. The second word represented Nazareth, or Nazarene, N. The third word represented king, which in Latin (REX) begins with an R. The fourth word represented Jews, (IVDAEORVM) again spelled beginning with an I. You can see that the INRI then says "Jesus Nazareth King Jews".

Do British people really still call First Nations Americans 'Red Indians'? If not, what do you say in its place?

If so, does it not occur to you how offensive it might be? Hi Ed...

I will try to answer honestly..I think some people are not admitting here... that "Red Indian" does get used ocassionaly (mostly by the uneducated) and certainly I remember in my life time it been used and people not thinking there was anything wrong with it . This was about 20 years ago though...
I even remember in one class when I was seven or eight where we learnt about all these new words such as Native American, and Inuit.....

And now I think most people would use Native American...First Nation Americans just sounds a little un natural to me..and to most British as well...

Whilst I think most people don't use Red Indian any longer...I think it is not viewed as really very offensive (nothing compared to the n or p word) but rather out dated, incorrect, and the people who use such a word are seen as people with out much contact with the outside world.

Having worked in an old people home before, and on council estates. I have certainly heard many people use that word. 
For the elderly it would be the same people who  use coloured to refer to black people. Often they don't mean any harm by it...but correct expression changes, and they are using the correct terminology from the 50's...and really do not realise how offensive it is.

They are also some people that are against "political correctness" and make a point of using such words
They can't understand why inuit is used not eskimo etc.- though I'm sure that is everywhere...not just the UK.


Finally...sorry for the babble...I do think because we do not live in America...We are sometimes a little slow with correct terminology for American groups...

I lived in Glasgow for 1 year around about 1998.. And I am certain that a visited a local museum where they had and exhibition of...
 "Red Indian costumes" - their words not mine! 

And one more thing because of the make up of our population I think some words are more offensive in the UK than in the USA / Canada...and visa versa...

What are the symptoms of being gay?  Tim,  I am going to treat your question as if it was just a poorly worded one and not attack you for that.

Gay people begin to realize they're gay because they're  "turned on" by people of the same gender and seek their company.  At first it isn't recognized as sexual, but overtime we begin to realize its a physical attraction and become aroused.

Its not something that happens overnight, nor can you just flip a switch and become gay.  Its something that you learn to accept over time.  Some of us realize at an early age (for me it was 14) others well into adulthood.  

Chances are that most gay people are afraid to come out for fear of upsetting their family and friends, or fear of rejection by their community.  This takes time too, to overcome.  The good news no one has to be "out" on anyone's schedule but their own.

There are plenty of sites on the internet that can address these issues of "coming out" if anyone is interested to do a search on a search engine like Ask.com or Google
