what are the 6th. , 7th. ...12th dimentions? I heared that there is more than 4 dimentions
what are they? Basically, the space that you and I experiences daily is 3 dimensions: up/down, left/right, forward/backwards. But space doesn't have to be 3 dimensions. It can be any number of dimensions. Of course, it is very difficult for us 3-dimensional beings to imagine what these dimensions are, or where they are. The problems is that we can NEVER see the fourth spatial dimension, never mind the 5th or the 6th, etc. etc. Let me explain why.

Imagine for a moment that we are 2-d beings, not 3-d. And we live on the surface of a sphere (like a ballon). This sphere is our universe. Everything we see, touch and experience happens on the surface of this sphere. We can go left/right and forward/backwards. But we can never go up or down. When we travel in one direction, we will eventually circumnavigate the sphere and make a complete circle, which brings us back to the initial starting point. If we ask the 2-d beings to imagine 3-dimensional space, all we can tell them is that the 3rd dimension (up/down) is orthogonal (a fancy way of saying perpendicular) to the surface of the sphere.

This is exactly our situation when we talk about the 4th, 5th, 6th, whatever nth dimension. They are defined as the dimension that is orthogonal to the n-1 th space. So the 4th dimension is orthogonal to our 3-dimensional space, and the 5th dimension is orthogonal to the 4-dimensional space, etc. etc.

Now about Super String Theory and these higher dimensions: what the theory predicts is that our universe does indeed have more than 3 spatial dimensions. Some version sof the theory say there are 10, some say there are 11. Whatever the number (it doesn't really matter in our discussion here), these higher spatial dimensions are currently curled up into very very tiny spaces. So what does that mean?

We now go back to our 2-d being living on a sphere example. For the time being, let's say we are now on a flat 2-dimensional surface (like a sheet of paper). Super String Theory says that the higher dimensions are curled up. So let's consider in our case the 3rd dimension as the curled up dimension. This means that if we were to magnify any point on the 2-d surface all the way to about 10^-35 meters (Planck Length), we will see that there is a tiny loop (like a loose thread on a knitted sweater).

Now imagine if our 2-d being were (1) small enough to see and fit inside the loop, and (2) able now to travel in the 3rd dimension, then for it to go in the up/down direction, the 2-d being will now be just going around in circles inside the loop. Remember in the previous case, our 2-d being can travel in one direction on the surface of the sphere and then return to the same point. Well, here our 2-d being is traversing through the 3rd dimension, except that there is no up and down because the 3rd dimension is "curled up" into a loop. So the 2-d being just goes around the loop in circles.

If you understood the above, then now we can answer the question, what and where are these higher dimensions in our universe. They are culred up in every point in our 3-dimensional space, and if we were small enough and we could move into these higher dimensions, then we would be moving through these very convoluted curled up loops, but not really able to go anywhere.

Because these higher dimensions are curled up into such tiny tiny loops (remember 10^-35 meters), only the most elementary structures like "strings" are affected by them. The size of these strings are of course on the order of 10^-35 meters long, and can traverse through the curl up dimensions. When the strings vibrate, the vibrations in the 3 large dimensions don't have any effect, but in the curled up higher dimensions, the vibrations can create resonance like playing a musical note.

These resonances are the stuff of reality, meaning these vibrational resonances of the strings inside the curled up dimensions is what creates matter and energy and thus everything that&#

verify that (sin3x)/sinx=3-4sin^2x?  sin3x = sin (x+ 2x) 
          = sinx.cos2x + cosx.sin2x
          = sinx (2cos^2x -1) + cosx (2sinx.cosx)
          = 2sinx.cos^2x - sinx + 2sinx.cos^2x
          = sinx (2cos^2x - 1 + 2cos^2x)
          = sinx (4cos^2x - 1)
 
 But, cos^2x = 1 - sin^2x
so then,

   sin3x = sinx [ 4 - 4sin^2x - 1]
             = sinx (3 - 4sin^2x)

 Therefore,

  sin3x/sinx =  sinx(3 - 4sin^2x)/sinx
                   =  3 - 4sin^2x  --- answer.

what is the process of anabolism?  All chemical processes are collectively known as metabolism.  The two parts of this are catabolism (which is breaking down big molecules into smaller molecules, such as when we digest food for nutrients, or destroy bodily toxins for excretion), and anabolism (which is the building of large molecules like proteins from smaller molecules like amino acids taken from food).  We have a bad habit of using the term metabolism to refer to catabolism when we talk about digestion and the burning of calories, but metabolism includes when we make new, big molecules.\n\nYou've probably heard reference to "anabolic steroids," which are steroids designed to enhance muscle growth.  That's because making big muscles means making a lot of the proteins that muscles are made of, like kinesin, dynein, and myosin.

what is a repressed gene?  DNA is in every cell, but not every gene is expressed in every cell.  The way that the cell controls which genes are activated and which aren't is through DNA-binding molecules called repressors and promoters.  A promoter binds to DNA near a gene and causes transcription of the gene to make mRNA that will go on to serve as a template for protein synthesis.  Conversely, a repressor can bind to a gene and prevent the transcription of that gene into an RNA template (usually depending on conditions in the cell at the time, like chemical messengers or availability of nutrients, etc.).

what is pulse - field gel electrophoresis? in molecular biological technique Think of a gel as a web of fibers, either polyacylamide or acrose.  This web creates a maze for the molecules to run through with the smallest molecules advancing faster than the larger molecules.

DNA, in particular, creates a problem.  The molecules are very long and fiber-like.  They have a tendency to get hung up on the fibers of the gel.  Pulse field electrophoresis provides a solution.

In pulse field electophoresis, the voltage difference across the gel is reversed repeatedly to prevent the problem of the molecules getting stuck on the fibers of the gel.  Initially, the positive charge is placed at the bottom of the gel.  As the DNA moves to the positive end, some of the molecules will get hung up.  So, at some point in time, the field is reversed so the positive charge is at the top of the gel.  The DNA molecules then move to the top of the gel.  Any hung up molecules are then freed.  Then the field is reversed again, so the molecules can continue their journey to the bottom of the gel.  The process is repeated several time throughout a gel run.

If the universe is infinite, there also exist thousands of Earth with billions of people like us am I right ? I think it's only a matter of probability, we have no chances to see each other but thousands of Earth like ours with people similar to us exist in theory. The universe is not actually infinite, although it is unimaginably large - perhaps up to thirty billion light years across with a couple of million galaxies.

However, the circumstances that created Earth are quite unique: only we emerged from the particular dust cloud that formed us, only on Earth did a 600 million year old glaciation lead to the pre-Cambrian explosion of soft-shelled complex life of the upper Ediacaran, and only on Earth did an asteroid hitting Mexico's coast clear out the large reptiles in order for the larger brained mammals to take over. 

In short, a very specific sequence of events permitted us. It is almost certain that the exact parallel events have not happened anywhere else.

That is not to say that there are not Earth-like worlds out there. The Hubble telescope has a new refraction technique that has allowed it to find rocky worlds in other solar systems, and it recently found a world that is somewhat similar to the Earth (but five times larger.)

But they would not be Earth.

There is one quantum mechanical derived theory that posits a new universe breaks off with each possible choice we make.  This was the premise of a sci-fi show, "Sliders", at one point. If such universes do exist in a multi-verse, we have no way to detect them or know they are there, unfortunately.

Why is it if you mix black and white and get gray, when white is all colors and black is colorless? Should'nt you get a rainbow or some thing White paint reflects nearly all of the light that hits it, so because you usually shine white light on it, the paint appears white.

To test this out, try shining a green light on white paint. What colour will it be? (Green)

Black paint, on the other hand, absorbs nearly all of the light that is shining on it so nothing bounces back at you.. so it looks black.

When you mix the black paint with the white paint, you have some of the mix absorbing the light and some of it reflecting the light. This means that when you shine a white light on the paint it doesn't reflect as much giving the dull white colour we call "gray"

write down the word equation that defines the magnitute of force.?  A force is a push or pull on an object.

Newton's second law states that a an applied force causes an object to accelerate.  It's one of the most if not the most powerful physics equations.  Force equals mass times acceleration.  F=ma.  So when an object falls the force of an object is equal to the mass of the object times the acceleration due to Earth's gravity (9.81 m/s/s or 9.81 meters per second per second or meters per second squared.)  All objects experience the same acceleration due to gravity.  The units for force are, oddly enough, called Newtons and one newton equals one kilogram times one meter per second squared.  One pound is 4.48 newtons. 

Now it's important to understand that newton's second law, F=ma, applies to net forces or unbalanced forces.  Just because an object is moving doesn't mean it's accelerating.  When you press the accelerator you car speeds up and the engine is exerting a net force on the car.  When your speed maxes out at 120 or however fast your car can go the force of the engine is ballanced against the forces against the car (friction from air, the road and the engine parts)  

Take tug of war.  An set of even matched teams won't result in one team moving across the line.  The forces are balanced.  Add one more strong guy to one team and the weaker team will speed up from zero to slowly moving across the line.  

Also force is cumulative.  When you can't pick up a heavy box what do you do?  You get help.  One smurf can lift a pebble but the whole smurf village can lift a boulder.

Also acceration is velocity divided by time a velocity is different from speed in that velocity is a vector, it has magnitude (speed) and direction.  If you change directions you will accelerate.

If you're in a train with no windows and an increadibly smooth track you shouldn't be able to tell that you are moving if the train't velocity is constant, however if it speeds up, slows down or goes around a corner while going at a constant speed the velocity is changing.  In the first two cases because of a change in magnitude (speed) in the last case because of a change in direction and you experience a force that pushes or pulls you in a direction.

Weight is the force due to gravity and can change due to the masses of the objects involved.  For example you may have a weight of 100 lbs on earth and a mass of 40 some kilograms but on the moon you weigh 1/6 as much but still have a mass of 40 kg.  On Earth you can convert between pounds (a measure of force) and kilograms (a measure of mass) because the acceleration due to Earth's gravity (9.81 meters per second squared) is the same and cancels out in the equation.

jacob's syndrome? i need info in jacob's syndrome im doing s prject on it... i need info on it Jacob's syndrome is a rare chromosomal disorder that affects males. It is caused by the presence of an extra Y chromosome. Males normally have one X and one Y chromosome. However, individuals with Jacob's syndrome have one X and two Y chromosome.
Males with Jacob's syndrome, also called XYY males.
Jacob's syndrome occurs when a male inherits two Y chromosomes from his father instead of one. He is an XYY male. Most males are XY.
The exact cause of the XYY aberration is unknown.
There are many symptoms associated with Jacob's Syndrome. The most common symptoms are:
    * learning problems at school
    * delayed emotional maturity
Males with Jacob’s syndrome are tall, thin, have acne, speech problems, and reading problems.
Males with XYY have no increased risk of developing additional diseases. In rare cases males with Jacobs Syndrome will also have Klinefelter's syndrome.
Males with Jacob's Syndrome will have a normal sexual libido and potency.

give reason? atoms from cr............cu have nearly the same diameter?  The atomic radii for Cr, Mn, Fe, Co, Ni, and Cu are

Cr: 125 pm
Mn: 137 pm
Fe: 124 pm
Co: 125 pm
Ni: 125 pm
Cu: 128 pm

So, you can see, there is a bit difference between their sizes. Although among them, Cr, Co, Ni, and Cu do have very similar atomic radius. 

The reason that these elements have similar radius is due to their electron configurations. So, let's look at their corresponding electron configuration first (hope you know what I am referring to) :

Cr: [Ar] 3d5 4s1
Mn: [Ar] 3d5 4s2
Fe: [Ar] 3d6 4s2
Co: [Ar] 3d7 4s2
Ni: [Ar] 3d8 4s2
Cu: [Ar] 3d10 4s1

As you may realize, the major difference between their electron configuration is mainly in the "3d" orbital, which has a quantum number (n) of 3; this 3d orbital has a smaller radius than the next orbital, 4s. The reason why 4s orbital is filled BEFORE 3d is due to the lower energy level of 4s compared to 3d.

In short, the major reason why these elements have similar radii is because the newly added electrons are not added to the "outermost electron shell", instead, they are added to the "inner electron shell". Therefore, no SIGNIFICANT changes to their radius.

What are some interesting facts about Chordates?  The Chordata is the animal phylum with which everyone is most intimately familiar, since it includes humans and other vertebrates. However, not all chordates are vertebrates. 

All chordates have the following features at some point in their life (in the case of humans and many other vertebrates, these features may only be present in the embryo): 


pharyngeal slits - a series of openings that connect the inside of the throat to the outside of the "neck". These are often, but not always, used as gills.
dorsal nerve cord - a bundle of nerve fibers which runs down the "back". It connects the brain with the lateral muscles and other organs.

notochord - cartilaginous rod running underneath, and supporting, the nerve cord.

post-anal tail - an extension of the body past the anal opening.

How does ink come out of pens?  This is from personal observation.  [Ballpoint] The body of a pen is hollow and contains a tube filled with ink, tapering to an open point.  That open point is plugged with a metal ball affixed in a position where it cannot get quite out of the barrel or into the supply of ink.  However, it can move slightly, and when pressed against a surface and pushed, the ball rotates, and the face turned to the ink is turned out of the pen and deposits that ink onto the surface, while the empty face rolls in to face the ink supply.

How can you make the work output of a machine greater than the work input? -by decreasing friction
-by increasing the input force
-by increasing the output distance
-none of the above
PLEASE DONT JUST GUESS ...GIVE ME AN ANSWER AND EXPLAIN IT. You cannot.  The law of conservation of energy states in lay language that energy can be neither created nor destroyed.  Therefore, getting more work out of a machine than is put into it is not possible.  In practical terms, even 100% efficiency, which would be getting an equal amount of work output, is not possible since some energy will always be lost due to forces such as friction.  Two terms describing the state where work output is greater than work input are "perpetual motion" and "free energy."  Unfortunately, neither one can exist.

I have gone back to look at this question. Contrary to what others have said, this question has been examined over and over and there is a substantial literature on it. The size and shape of eggs is very interesting to people in the poultry industry, and those who must develop machinery that interacts with eggs, as well as environmentalists and others. 

There are several problems here clearly. One is, there is no uniform shape to an egg. Different animals and different species produce different-shaped eggs.

The second is, there is no easy formula available for an egg shape that is well-known.


That said, there are lots of approximation and estimation methods available, as well as lots of experimental data and tables for different kinds of eggs. 

In general, for eggs that are rotationally symmetric about an axis, the surface area 

A= 2*pi* {int from a to b} y(x) * sqrt[1+y'(x)] dx

where y(x) is the curve describing the boundary of the egg, 
a<=x<=b. If y(x) is analytic, then this integral can be done analytically. If not, it can be done numerically, as done by one of the references. 

In the case of hen's eggs, T. C. Carter (1968) produced a 3 parameter model for computing surface area ("The hen's egg: A mathematical model with three parameters", Brit. Poulty Sci. 9, 165-171, 1968). In 1949, Romanoff, A. L., and A. J. Romanoff published a book with many formulae and approximation methods for egg surface areas called "The
avian egg" (John Wiley & Sons, Inc., New York, 1949).

One of the references approximates the egg as a prolate spheroid to compute its surface area. 
 
Some of the references produce empirical formulae for the volume and surface areas of various shapes of eggs. For example, the abstract by V. G. Narushin in the references presents the presumably empirically fit-model of egg surface area, S, calculated as S = (3.155 – 0.0136L + 0.0115B)LB, in which both L and B are taken in millimeters (obviously there is a problem with the units here). 

One of the other references presents some empirically-derived formulae relating weight W of the egg to its surface area A that appear to fit quite closely (for example, A=4.835*W^0.662).

I think that once you decide exactly what sort of egg you are interested in, there is a wealth of material available to investigate this further.

question, no idea wat to do plz help? In a “Rotor-ride” at a carnival, people are rotated in a cylindrically walled “room”. The room radius is 4.6 m, and the rotation frequency is 0.50 revolutions per second when the floor drops out. What is the minimum coefficient of static fric-tion so that the people will not slip down? The force of static friction is the product of the force normal to the surface and the coefficient of friction. This force must be greater than or equal to the passenger's weight. First, we find the acceleration:

a = v²/r = ω²r, where ω is the angular velocity in rad/s
ω=.5 rev/s = π rad/s
a=4.6π² m/s² ≈ 45.40018 m/s²

The normal force producing this acceleration is:
F = ma = m*4.6π² m/s²
So the maximum force of static friction is:
μ*m*4.6π² m/s²

(Note: those units are correct - I'm not writing the kg because the units of mass are contained in the term for mass - if I were to substitute a particular mass, I would get something like μ*(60 kg) * 4.6π² m/s², so writing kg a second time would be redundant).

Now, the weight of a passenger is:
F=mg ≈ m*9.81 m/s²

So we have:
μ*m*4.6π² m/s² ≥ m*9.81 m/s²

dividing by m*4.6π² m/s:

μ ≥ 0.216079

However, since our initial values were only given to two significant digits:

μ ≥ 0.22

When you get a blood transfusion, does the DNA of all that blood eventually match up to yours? And what about organ transplants, does their DNA stay exactly the same forever? Blood is composed of red blood cells and plasma.  Red blood cells are responsible for carying oxygen.  They don't have a nucleus, and thus, no DNA, and also do not have mitochondria, so no mitochondrial DNA, either.  So, no DNA, no problem.

Blood typing is based on the presence of A and B protiens on the surface of the red blood cell, and the Rh factor (another protien).  AB+ people can accept all blood types, while O- people can donate to any blood type (making their blood highly valuable to blood banks.) Blood type B is by far the most common in world demographics. 

People are matched on blood type for both blood transfusions and organ transplants.  Plus, for organ transplants they also look at the donor/recipeint histocompatability, which is basically the antigens the bodies of the people involved produce.  Foreign antigens trigger the body's immune response, so finding people with the same antigens helps avoid rejection, as well as drug treatments.

In short, no matter what you add to your body from another person, the DNA is never "changed".  The human genome is far too complex to be able to simply assimilate (while this is a very common means of mutating in bacteria called transformation).

What treatment is available for OCD?
OCD is not usually curable, but it is highly treatable, in that effective treatment can greatly reduce the occurrence of obsessive thoughts and compulsive rituals. A combination of behavior therapy and medication seems to offer the best long-term improvement. 

Exposure Treatment and Response Prevention
A type of behavioral therapy called exposure and response prevention is generally the first line of treatment for OCD.  In this treatment, you are repeatedly exposed to the source of your obsession. Then you are prevented from engaging in whatever compulsive ritual you use to reduce the anxiety brought about by your obsession. For example, if you are a compulsive hand washer, you might be asked to touch the door handle in a public restroom and then be prevented from washing up. As you sit with the anxiety, the urge to wash your hands will gradually begin to go away on its own. In this way, you learn that you don’t need the ritual to get rid of your anxiety.

Exposure treatment and response prevention is carefully planned out and controlled, with your therapist at your side to provide support. You will begin with a situation that provokes only a low level of anxiety. Once you’ve been exposed to this situation and have waited out the anxiety without engaging in your compulsion, you will move on to a more challenging situation. Continuing with the previous example, you might progress from touching the bathroom door handle to touching the toilet flush lever or even the toilet seat itself. With each successful exposure and response prevention, you’ll feel a greater sense of control over your obsessions and compulsions. Studies show that exposure and response prevention can actually “retrain” the brain to function differently, permanently reducing the occurrence of OCD symptoms. This type of behavioral therapy can even extinguish compulsive behaviors entirely.

According to the Academy of Cognitive Therapy, 75% of people who complete exposure and response prevention treatment experience improvement of their OCD symptoms.
For more information about this behavioral treatment, read What Is Exposure & Response Prevention? and Exposure and Response Prevention (ERP).

Cognitive Therapy
A cognitive component is often combined with the behavioral approach of exposure and response prevention. Cognitive therapy targets the OCD sufferer’s catastrophic thoughts and exaggerated sense of responsibility. According to OCD Action, “Cognitive therapy suggests that OCD results when an individual misinterprets intrusive thoughts or urges as a sign that not only will harm occur, but that they may be responsible for it through what they do or what they fail to do.” Therefore, a central task of therapy is to address these irrational thoughts and challenge them. See Treatments for OCD: Cognitive Therapy for an overview of the cognitive approach and useful treatment tools, including thought records. For more on how OCD leads to biased and unproductive ways of thinking, visit Cognitive Therapy for OCD: What It is, When to Use It and When Not! 

To review the main ideas involved in a combined cognitive-behavioral approach to OCD treatment, read OCD-UK’s What is Cognitive Behavioural Therapy (CBT)?

Medication

What is a mangrove? mangrove? The term mangrove requires a detail explanation. It runs as follows:-
 A peculiar type of vegetation exists in the littoral zones in the tropical and subtropical parts of the world.
Littoral zone means a zone between low tide and high tide of a sea. It is now obvious that the mangrove vegetation is found along the sea shores, creeks and near the river mouth or estuaries where it meets the sea.
These mangroves are, over the ages, adapted to live in salty , water logged soil and evolved their own life style.
These are all medium sized or small shrubby trees provided with breathing roots that always stand up right above the soil surface and do gaseous exchange directly through the air. Since they always grow close together, the mangrove plants form a  dense vegetation called Mangrove Vegetation. The individual members may belong to different species.
Rhizophora, Aviccenia are well known; but there are scores of others.
IMPORTANCE:-1) The mangrove vegetation forms a kind of buffer zone between the sea and the land and prevents land erosion and sea encroachment.
2) It provides innumerable small organism a safe shelter, feeding and breeding ground. These organism are important link in the aquatic food chain.

How dou make a 3-D topographic map? I have to do this science project to make a model of a topographic map & i dont know how to make it. Can someone plz help me out. I assume you mean a physical topagraphic map, not a digital one.  If so, this is one way that might work for you:

First, you need a topagraphic map of the area you want to make...i.e. one that shows elevation changes.  Now, you want one that is big enough for your project and a way to copy it and / or enlarge / shrink it if you need to.

Secondly, you will need lots of thick poster board, the kind that has the styrofoam like backing, or in a pinch, thick cardboard from a few boxes would work fine too, but something that will be fairly easy to cut.  You will need at least one sheet that will be the base (i.e. the lowest elevation)

Look at your map and see the highest point and the lowest point and what elevation (i.e. change in height) each topagraphic line on the map represents.  Trace out each elevation onto a separate sheet of posterboard.  Or if you want, make lots of copies of the map and cut out each elevation and glue it to a separate piece of poster board.  REMEMBER:  write down the elevation on the board or else you won't know which layer it will belong later!

Now carefully with an Exacto knife or what ever sharp object you might have, cut out each elevation from the boards, starting with the lowest above the base, then glue it to the base.  Then cut out the next layer and glue it to the appropriate area and so on. When you are done, you should end up with a model that looks just like the original topagraphic map but in 3D.

Though it is not necessary, for greater accuracy and difficulty, you could make the thickness changes be in scale to the map.  For example, if 1/4 inch is the equal to a distance of 500 feet on the map, then each 1/4 inch layer should represent a rise of 500 feet above the base.  Whatever you do, just be consistent, and the map should look great.

I hope that helps! :-)

I have a physics test tomorrow and need massive help!!? A 10kg block is set moving with an initial speed of 6m/s on a rough horizontal surface.  If the force of friction is 20N, approximately how far does the block travel before it stops?? Please Explain!! Thanks. Well the first thing to do in a problem like this is extract information from it.
1.) Weight of Block = 10kg
2.) Velocity of block(Vi) = 6m/s
3.) Final velocity of block(Vf) = 0m/s
4.) Friction acting on block = 20N The friction is always opposite of the direction of the block.

Second:
What are we calculating? Distance traveled by block! DISTANCE.  We need a formula that will give us distance as an answer! So...we have final velocity, initial velocity, and distance....lets see...how about this one...
 vf^(2) = vi^(2) + 2*a*d 

This equation has Vf, Vi, and D.  
Vf = 0 m/s
Vi = 6 m/s
D = What we are trying to find.
The only thing missing in this equation that we have to find is (a) or acceleration. Hmm.

There is actually acceleration on  the block.  Friction is acting on the block in the opposite direction; therefore the block is decelerating.  We can use F=ma to find the force of deceleration.
Friction Force = 20N
Mass = 10kg
Acceleration = ?

Use the following equation:
F=ma
1.) -20N = 10kg * a
2.) a = -2 m/s (Yes it's negative b/c we are decelerating!)

Now we go back to the original problem!
 vf^(2) = vi^(2) + 2*a*d 

Thus
(0^2) = (6^2) + (2)*(-2)*(d)
0 = 36 - 4d
-36 = -4d.
Distance = 9meters! (Make sure to get the units correct!)
I think I got this right...if not tell me what I did wrong pls

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The guy who did it using Energy equations forgot to add one thing....
mass x (velocity)^2 = Force x distance
so 10kg * (6m/s)^2 = 20N * x
so (10 * 36)/20 = 18 meters

This is another way to do it.  He is using the energy equations to calculate energy in the block. When the block is in motion there is Kinetic Energy in it.  When the block has no motion, there is zero Kinetic Energy in it.  However, the individual that did this messed up the equation as follows:
Ke = (1/2) * Mass * Velocity^2

Thus the answer is not 18 but 9 meters!!!!!
Here is the correction:
1.) .5*mass x (velocity)^2 = Force x distance
2.) .5*10kg*(6m/s)^2 = 20N * x distance
3.) (5 * 36)/20 = distance\
4.) Distance =9 meters!

how does the zero product relate to the quadratic equation?  The zero product rule says that if two numbers multiply out to be zero, then one of the numbers must be zero.  It's used in quadratic equations (not to be confused with the quadratic formula) when they are factored by a method often called "FOIL".

Example:  Solve x^2 - 8x + 15 = 0

Factored, this is (x-3)(x-5)=0

Because of the zero property you know that either x-3=0 or x-5=0.

So you solve each small equation to get the possible values of x (3 or 5).

why does water have a higher melting and boiling points than other molecules with similar molecular weights?  It's because of the H-bonding of water molecules (18g/mol). H-bonding is stronger than Van der Waals forces - for example in methane CH4 (16g/mol), which is gas at room temperature. Besides, water is unique because its oxygen atom has two lone pairs and two hydrogen atoms, meaning that the total number of H-bonds of a water molecule is up to four. Unlike in ammonia NH3 (17g/mol), there's only one H-bond since nitrogen has only one lone pair. Consequently, its melting and boiling points are lower than water (ammonia is also gas at room temp).

Does anyone know where there are pictures taken from a telescope of the american flag on the moon?  Due to atmospheric interference, it would not be possible to see any mad made object left on the moon from a telescope on the surface of Earth.
However, there is a very powerful, Earth orbiting, telescope which is free from atmospheric distortions…the Hubble space telescope.  However, even this telescope, as powerful as it is, could not possibly see the flag left on the moon.

Using a little math and common sense, it would not nearly be possible to see the flag on the moon with the Hubble space telescope.

First, let’s get some basic facts straight.
The Diameter of the Hubble telescope is 2.4 meters and the distance from the Earth to the moon (on average) is about 3.84 E8 meters.

Pretty much the only thing limiting what Hubble can and cannot resolve is diffraction through a circular aperture (i.e. how light waves interact with each other when they get to Hubble's mirror.
The minimum angle which a circular aperture can resolve is given by the formula,
Theta_min = 1.22 Lambda / D
where Theta min is the minimum angle, Lambda is the wavelength of light we are using, and D is the diameter of the opening.

If we assume we are using light at 500 nm (roughly the middle of the visible spectrum) and we know that Hubble's diameter is 2.4 meters, we can find the minimum angle to be,
Theta_min = 2.54 E-7 radians.
This is quite a small angle by Earthly standards, but will it compare to the angle to the flag on the moon?...we'll see.

Here is where I have to make an assumption, but it is a very reasonable assumption and one that will assure us that out answer is correct. Watching the moon landing videos, one can see that the astronauts placed a moderately sized flag on a pole on the moon. Although I don’t know the exact dimensions of the flag, I can assure you, it was definitely no bigger than 10 ft. But for the sake of argument and to make the numbers easier, let’s assume it was 10 feet (~3 meters).
If the distance between the flag and Hubble is the same (about) as the distance from the Earth to the moon, then we can calculate the angle between the top of the flag and the bottom of the flag pole as seen by Hubble orbiting Earth. The angle comes out to be about, 7.81 E-9 radians, about 30 times SMALLER than the absolute minimum angle Hubble can resolve...and this is if we assume that the flag is 10 ft, which it obviously is smaller than that in reality.

Plus, Hubble was specifically designed to look at VERY distant object. Although the moon is far away, it might as well be right next to us compared to the stars/galaxies/.. Hubble is supposed to be looking at. Therefore, I don’t know exactly how it will respond looking at such a close and bright object.

One this is sure through, you could not see the flag, even with one of the best telescopes ever built operating perfectly under ideal conditions using visible light.

I need help solving: 2x^5-8x^4+7x^3-10x^2+10x-5 for maximum, minimum, and inflection points.  HOW? i have no clue of how to solve this thing. The first derivative of this is

10x^4 - 32x^3 + 21x^2 - 20x + 10

Set that equal to zero and solve for the FOUR solutions. That will give you the x values of the four turning points that are the maxima and minima of the original equation. 

The second derivative will serve two purposes. It will enable to you to find the thtree inflection points, and also enable you to tell which of the four turning points of the curve are maxima and which of them are minima.

The second derivative is 

40x^3 - 96x^2 + 42x - 20

Set that equal to zero and solve. The three solutions give you the x-values of the three inflection points. To use the second derivative to find which turning points are maxima and which are minima, plug in the value of x for each turning point into the second derivative. If the value of the second derivative is positive, the turning point in a minimum. If it is negative, the turning point is a maximum.

Do birds that cannot see the other birds around them sing more than ones that do see other birds?  No, birds are stimulated to sing based upon what they hear, not what they see- the bird song is made specifically for this, so that potential mates and/or potential intruders on territory are aware of each other even though they are not in sight.

A Magnet Question? I am at my workbench and bored , so i;m doing a little experiment. I have one allan key and one magnet, when I move the maget close to the allan key there is no attraction, until I get a certain distance away,(say 2 cm's for aguements sake) then the allan key zooms towards the magnet so fast I cannot pull the magnet away fast enough.

This happens as well if i go really really slow, no attraction then bamm, the allan key is stuck to the magnet.
How comes I cant get to a distance where the allan key is slowly attracted to the magnet, so i can pull the magnet away and they both move at the same speed. There's two reasons for the sudden "leap" of your allen key towards the magnet.

Firstly, magnetic force is proportional to the inverse square of the distance over which it acts.  (to put it another way, if you halve the distance, the force is quadrupled).

Secondly, the friction force between your allen key and the bench becomes much less when the allen key starts moving (this is called mu (mew) slip).

Yes, it is possible to maintain a distance which will continually pull the allen key along.  It's a case of balancing the force of attraction from the magnet and the friction force. This is a whole lot easier to do if the friction force is proportional to the speed of movement, so that the faster it goes the more force there is holding it back.  One way to achieve this is to put your allen key in a little boat on some water.

Best regards.

Whats so good nutritionally, about not-made-from-concentrate juices? I understand why concentrates are used - for shipping, etc...  But is there any real difference nutritionally / chemically between rehydrated concentrate or the natural thing? The answer to this question would depend entirely upon the juice and its vitamin constituents, and their survivability in a hydrated versus concentrated state.  Some nutrients cannot or have difficulty surviving outside of liquid suspension, resulting in their chemical breakdown.  This also applies to non-nutritional components which although will not change the nutritional level of the food or beverage, it can most definitely modify its taste or texture.  This is why many concentrated or dehydrated foods taste very different than "fresh" equivalents.\n\nOn the other hand, some vitamins can maintain their structure even better when concentrated.  I mention this because it is widely accepted that ascorbic acid (vitamin C) is one of these, and is probably the one with which people are most concerned when asking about juice concentrates.  It is widely accepted that ascorbic acid degrades over time in fresh and NFC juices, but degrades more slowly (probably due to its frozen state) in from-concentrate products.

Why is it so foggy in San Francisco?  It isn't as foggy as you might think. Spring and Fall are quite temperate, and San Francisco is renowned for it's "Indian Summer" in September. However, Mark Twain had a point when he said "The coldest Winter I ever spent was Summer in San Francisco."\nThis is because the warm air from inland (where it gets quite hot in the Summer) clashes with the cold air from the surrounding Pacific Ocean and the SF Bay. When that happens, fog forms. Further explanation from http://kids.earth.nasa.gov: "At night, the ground surface cools by radiating heat to space. Air near the ground cools to the dew point temperature, causing water in the air to condense."\nSure it's cold, but fog can be quite beautiful and atmospheric. Just look at the pictures on http://www.goldengatephoto.com/sanfran/thefogrollsin.html  Lovely!

how do aliens travel so long distance to reach the earth? if aliens do travel very long distances then they must be going faster than the speed of light which violates our law,right? Aliens travel through wormholes, meaning they don't fly long distances to get to earth. \n\n"Intra-universe wormholes connect one location of a universe to another location of the same universe(in the same present time). A wormhole should be able to connect distant locations in the universe by bending spacetime, allowing travel between them that is faster than it would take light to make the journey through normal space. See the image above. Inter-universe wormholes connect one universe with another [1], [2]. This gives rise to the speculation that such wormholes could be used to travel from one parallel universe to another. A wormhole which connects (usually closed) universes is often called a Schwarzschild wormhole. Another application of a wormhole might be time travel. In that case it is a shortcut from one point in space and time to another. In string theory a wormhole has been envisioned to connect two D-branes, where the mouths are attached to the branes and are connected by a flux tube [3]. Finally, wormholes are believed to be a part of spacetime foam [4]. There are two main types of wormholes: Lorentzian wormholes and Euclidean wormholes. Lorentzian wormholes are mainly studied in semiclassical gravity and Euclidean wormholes are studied in particle physics. Traversable wormholes are a special kind of Lorentzian wormholes which would allow a human to travel from one side of the wormhole to the other. Sergey Krasnikov tossed the term spacetime shortcut as a more general term for (traversable) wormholes and propulsion systems like the Alcubierre drive and the Krasnikov tube to indicate hyperfast interstellar travel."

How many seconds will go by until  the 3 strands blink at the same time? Sahale decorated his house with 3 strands of holiday.The red Strand blinks every 4 seconds, the green strands blinks every 6 seconds and  the white strands blink every 10 seconds. How many seconds will go by until the 3 strands blink at the same time? Calculate the least common multiple of the times of the three strands:

Red strand = 4 seconds (= 2 * 2)
Green Strand = 6 seconds (= 2 * 3)
White strand = 10 seconds (= 2 * 5)

The least common multiple is 2 * 2 * 3 * 5 = 60 seconds.  So all strands will blink together at the 60th second.

what kind of muscle fibers the body use in mountain climbing?  The body doesnt use one type of fiber exclusively in anything-it has three.  Very slow, which are highly vascularized and have amazing endurance, intermediate, which are sort of a mix, and fast, which are explosive-but, to some degree all are involved in anything. For any given movement, such as grabbing a handhold and pulling yourself up, and holding yourself, the fractions of the different fibres being used would change from second to second.  But, the thing is, which fibres can be trained more?  For slow fibres, an excellent overall cardiovascular fitness regimen is sufficient-you dont need to do anything specifically for the arm and shoulder muscles for slow fibres.  The best weightlifting regimen for this kind of sport is explosive speed/strength training, in which you use 30-50% of the maximum weight you can lift (for any given movement), and accelerate it quickly through as large a range of motion as you can-  It takes some months to build up to a really fast acceleration, because this training has a potential to cause muscle tears and joint damage (just like strength training of any kind).  Stretching is also very good for speed/strength, but *never* stretch to the point of pain-it significantly weakens the muscle for hours afterwards.

Isn't the healthiest cure for high cholesterol levels simply to become vegan?  Why is this never mentioned? I see advertisements on TV about prescription drugs that purport to lower cholesterol levels, as well as medications that can be taken with food to block the absorption of saturated fat and reduce the presence of cholesterol in the body.  From what I've heard, there are some considerable, negative side effects to this all, one example being liver damage.

So, I looked up what the "high cholesterol" and high saturated fat foods are. From what I can tell, nearly all of them are animal products (egg yolks, animal organs, butter, etc.).

I've never seen anything in the news media, though, about this.  I would think it'd be pretty obvious that the easiest way to avoid a high cholesterol condition is to simply (duh?) avoid eating food that's bad for you like animal products.

So my questions are these:
- Am I accurate in saying that most high cholesterol foods are animal based?
- Why is there so little said about the benefits of a vegan diet to remedy this condition? Cholesterol is only in animal foods...there are plant sterols, but they are NOT the negative animal cholesterol.  Although it is true that cholesterol is made by your body (as you do need some for vital bodily functions), adding cholesterol in your diet is definitely one of the major problems with the "bad" cholesterol that causes problems.  Saturated fat (which is in plant and animal products, but more so in animal products) also plays a part in cholesterol production:  if you have too much saturated fat, it is turned into cholesterol by your body.  There have been studies that show that a vegan diet not only helps with high cholesterol, but also many cancers, many autoimmune disorders, asthma, allergies, etc.  Since there  are obviously people who have been brainwashed by the meat/dairy/egg industries, you don't hear much about vegan diets as all the propoganda spewed about how "unhealthy" these diets are.  (The American Dietetic Association, as well as the Canadian version and the World Health Organization, ALL admit that a well-balanced vegan diet is one of the healthiest all around.)

what is scientists average salary in the world?  It depends whether the scientist is working in the public sector, i.e. university, government, or the private sector, i.e. a corporation large enough to have its own research department.

The private sector scientist will make much more money but there are other disadvantages. The private sector scientist will not be able to chose his or her research topic or communicate results openly to the rest of the world. There is a lot of pressure to produce useful results quickly so basic research is usually done in the public sector.

As for the exact amounts of pay, it is highly variable by country. I know Egyptian scientists who have to hold two jobs in order to support their families.

In the private sector, salary depends on how much grant money you bring in to your institution.

what are the organs associated with the male reproductive system?  Male reproductive organs or male reproductive system 

The main reproductive organs of the male body are the testes, which produce sperm and also male hormones, in the form of testosterone. The male reproductive system also includes the external genitals — the penis and the scrotum — and the internal structures, including the prostate gland, the vas deferentia (plural for the 2 vas deferens), the urethra, and the seminal vesicles.

Testes
The paired oval testes, also known as the male gonads, hang in the scrotal sac. Usually the right testis hangs higher than the left one by about 1 cm. The testes hang outside the body because the temperature inside the body is too high to produce sperm, so they are produced in the testes at about 3 °C lower than body temperature.

Epididymis
At the back of the olive-shaped body of each testis is a cap formed by the many coils of a 20-foot long tube called the epididymis. The function of the epididymis is to collect the immature sperm from the testis.

As the sperm make their long journey through the epididymis they become mature sperm. This journey takes about 20 days and during its course the sperm become fertile and they also become able to move in a swimming motion (doctors refer to the sperm then as ‘motile’).

Vas deferens
Joined to the epididymis is the vas deferens — a thick walled tube which transports sperm from the epididymis up to the prostate gland. The section of the vas deferens that is above the testis can be felt through the loose part of the scrotum. When a vasectomy is performed, it is this part of the vas deferens that is snipped.

The vas deferens empties into the ejaculatory duct, which passes through the prostate gland to merge with the urethra.

The urethra
The urethra serves as the tube down which urine passes from the bladder through the penis to the outside and also the tube down which semen is ejaculated.

The prostate
The prostate is a walnut-shaped gland that surrounds the urethra. Along with the seminal vesicles it produces the fluid secretions that support and nourish the sperm. Without this fluid to dilute them the sperm cannot move easily.

After the age of 40 the prostate enlarges and can press on the urethra. An enlarged prostate is often the cause of urinary problems in older men.

The wavelength of light is 310 nm.  Calculate its frequency? The wavelength of light is 310 nm.  Calculate its frequency?

Can sum1 explain how they got the answer. and what does (nm) mean? Frequency = velocity of propagation / wavelength.

For light, we assume it is moving in a vacuum, so vp is 3e8 m/s.  The wavelength of 310nm is 310e-9 meters.  Then we plug the numbers in, and we get (3e8 m/s) / (310e-9 m) = 967.742e12 Hz because 1/s is the same as cycles/sec, which is a Hertz.

At what temprature does celcius and Farehnheit equal?  When the temperature is -40 degrees Celsius it is equal to -40 degrees Fahrenheit. The two measures of temperature are related by the following equation:

Tc = (5/9)*(Tf-32)

Tc = temperature in degrees Celsius
Tf = temperature in degrees Fahrenheit

If you plug in -40 for either Tc or Tf and solve for the other variable you will get -40.

Isnt Carbon 14 Dating based on probability Formula rather than deterministic? lamda constant based on determined results? Definitely probabilistic, but it uses deterministic processes.

First of all, it has some significant assumptions:
- Carbon dating assumes the dead object was in carbon equilibrium with the surroundings.  This is fine.
- It assumes the amount of carbon in an object 1000's of years old is the same as an object today.  Maybe fine if there are existing specimens.  Not so good with dinosaurs.
- It assumes the ratio of C-14 to normal Carbon is exactly the same as it is today.  Probably not so fine (think ozone layer).

Radioactive decay is deterministic and measuring it is deterministic (you can conclusively point to a number that directly relates to decay rate), but radioactive dating (of which carbon dating is just one type) is based on the probability of carbon decay.  It assumes C-14 will decay at a specific rate.  The likelihood of this probability is very high to about 50,000-100,000 years, at which point there is too much uncertainty in the assumption and too little decay to measure accurately.  This is why they do not use carbon dating for dinosaur fossils, for example.

graph line through the point (5,-3) with undefined slope? Thank you all The slope intercept form of the line is 

y = mx + b where m = slope and b = y-intercept

Since (5, -3) lies on the line then

-3 = 5m + b

ie 5m + b - 3 = o

So any line in which m = (3 - b)/5

eg b = -2, m = 1 So y = x - 2
b = 8, m = -1 So y = 8 - x ....... and so forth

Graphing m against b would give all the values of m, b that satisfy the given condition.

Why is someone more likely to bleed to death when an artery is cleanly severed rather than crushed or torn?  A cleanly severed vessel is less likely to clot, therefore less likely to stop the blood flow. A crushed or mangled vessel has more places for the clot to form, so it could potentially stop the bleeding. Think of it like a garden hose - a nice clean cut gets a lot of water thrugh it. A mangled end still lets water out, but it impedes the flow. The slower the flow, the better chance of clotting (plus a slower flow means less blood loss).

is it possible to take a picture of a black hole? i thought the pull of gravity was so strong that even light could not escape, making a picture of a black hole impossible to take. so explain this?

http://www.ibold.net/2006/04/19/picture-of-the-two-black-holes-colliding In that picture you are viewing the very bright hot disc of matter spiralling around the black hole. It's called an accretion disc. The black hole is actually at the centre of each disc and is invisible. The accretion discs are far enough from the black hole's influence for the light from them to be able to escape.

You can't see the black holes; you can see the influence they have on the gas around them.

A previous answer claimed that it was a false-colour picture. While this may be true, bear in mind that some electromagnetic radiation MUST have been intercepted by the telescope or there would be no picture at all.
The above picture was probably taken in the x-ray spectrum, since the very hot accretion discs are visible.

do birds urinate?  Covertwalrus (nice nickname!) is right. The stools of birds are more or less semi-solid and include a dark part (the feces) and a whitish part (the urates or uric acid excreted from the kidneys). In some species these two parts are more separate (i.e. pigeons) whereas in others they blend into a brownish-grayish stool (i.e. hens).\nSauropsids (birds and reptiles) do not produce liquid urine; the final product from kidney activity is uric acid that forms solid crystals, thus allowing them to save their body water instead of using large volumes to dilute urea (as in amphibians and mammals).

I have a Ca(OH)2 solution titrated with HCl.  I need to find molar solubility.  Anybody got any ideas? I just need the general idea for this problem.  No need for numbers.. I just want the general formula.  :) thanks 1. Make sure that HCl is standardized.
2. Write the balance equation:

Ca(OH)2 + 2HCl ---> CaCl2 + 2H2O

- this means that 1 mole of Ca(OH)2 reacts for every 2 moles of HCl

3. Get the number of moles of HCl reacted by multiplying the volume used to react Ca(OH)2 by the actual concentration of HCl (value from standardization). Divide the result by 2 - and this is now your moles Ca(OH)2.

4. Get the molar solubility of Ca(OH)2 by dividing its number of moles by its volume. Unit is in gram per liter.

Probability? In a game of chance, the player randomly draws two balls at the SAME TIME from an urn containing 2 red balls and 5 black balls. Find the probability that the player draws exactly one red ball.

Can anyone pls help? Thanks! Total number of balls: 7
Let's say the player draws each ball with each hand.
There can be 2 situations:
1)Player draws 1 red ball with left hand and 1 black ball with right hand: (2/7 * 5/6)
2)Player draws 1 red ball with right hand and 1 black ball with left hand: (5/7 * 2/6)

Therefore, probability of drawing exactly 1 red ball is (2/7 * 5/6) + (5/7 * 2/6)= 10/21

And, find the area under the curve y=5/x and the x-axis for x between -2 and -4.  Thanks! 1) the integral of e^(stuff) is

how to extrapolate on a graph drawn on paper both for ordinary data and frequency distribution data.?  What you do with extra-polation is assuming that the data is developping along a linear function. So you'll be searching for the function y = c * x where the sum of (your found y-data minus the y-value from the function) is at its minimum.
Say you found:
(x,y) = (7,3); (23,8); (26,7); (30,11)

The function values for these x-values would be:
(x,y) = (7,7c); (23,23c); (26,26c); (30,30c)

And the sum of the differences:
T = (3-7c) + (8-23c) + (7-26c) + (11-30c) =>
T = 29 - 86c

T is at its minimum as T = 0, so:
29 - 86c = 0 =>
c = 29/86

So the line you would be looking for is y = 29/86 * x

What are the things you must know to be a Cheif production operator in petroleum industry?  I'm a Petroleum Engineer, graduated from the University of Tulsa in 1979, and my principle job was Production Engineering, which is probably similar to a Production Operator, or maybe the same thing.

First, it will probably require a four-year degree in Petroleum Engineering. You must find this out first, otherwise, "the things you must know" are unimportant.

Where the Geologist is responsible for "where" a well is drilled, the Engineer usually determines if the well will produce from complex wireline logs that are ran when the drilling rig reaches Total Depth. 

The Production Engineer takes control of an oil or gas well immediately after it has been drilled, before the drilling rig is dismantled and moved off the pad. He determines and  designs the size and thickness of the casing and wellhead, according to the depth, pressure, and production capabilities of the well, then determines the amount of cement needed to cement the casing in place.

Then the completion of the well begins, and a workover rig is moved over the hole. In short, another wireline truck is moved over the hole, and holes are shot in the casing into the producing sand. The formation is then acidized and fractured hydraulically. If it produces, a production string of tubing is run in the hole.

If the well won't flow, then a pumping unit must be sized for the depth, production, etc.

A tank battery is set up on location, including a separator, heater treater, and several tanks, depending on the amount of the production.

Later in the life of the well, an engineer will be responsible for re-completing the well to another formation, or plugging and abandoning the well according to State regulations.

A Production Operator is resposible for the production from several hundred wells, and when one stops producing, he must figure out why and get it bakc on line with the least of expense.

Why are all outer planets well placed for observation at opposition, but inner planets such as Mars are not?  You are confusing the terms here.

Only planets outside the orbit of the Earth (superior) are ever at opposition.  Opposition is when the Sun, Earth and that planet line up in that order*.  Therefore, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune can all be at opposition.  Inferior planets though that orbit inside the Earth's orbit, (namely Venus and Mercury) can never be at opposition because their orbits will never take them past the Earth so that the Earth will be between them and the sun.

Inferior planets can, however be at conjunction.  This is when either the planet, sun and Earth line up in that order or the sun, the planet and the Earth line up in that order*.

Opposition is an alright time to view a planet because it is fully illuminated.  If a light source is behind you and you look at something you see it is totally illuminated (assuming it's far enough away for your shadow to not interfere).  The conjunction that Mercury and Venus expirience is a very bad time to view the planets because either they are infront of the sun from our point of view and so we can't make the planet out in the blinding light, or it is behind the sun from our point of view anyway*.

But they are all happening on parallel time lines on that same day, minute, second, etc. Anything is possible "if" another impossible thing is found to be possible; so long as the original thing is made possible by the formerly impossible thing.

In other words, of course time travel is possible so long as other impossible things become possible that would make it possible, such as your catalyst which would open a space and time rift.

Therefore, the real question is not whether time travel is possible, but whether any catalyst does exist that would make it possible.

What is the depth of the deepest part of the ocean?  The Mariana Trench the deepest past of the ocean.  It is 35,813 ft/10,915m deep.  It is located in the Pacific Ocean, just east of the 14 Mariana Islands (11"21' North latitude and 142" 12' East longitude ) near Japan.   It is also the deepest location of the earth itself.  It was created by ocean-to-ocean subduction, a phenomena in which a plate topped by oceanic crust is subducted beneath another plate topped by oceanic crust.

Who was Reimann?What was his hypothesis?  From Wikipedia.org: 'Georg Friedrich Bernhard Riemann (September 17, 1826 - July 20, 1866) (pronounced REE mahn or in IPA ['ri:man]) was a German mathematician who made important contributions to analysis and differential geometry, some of them paving the way for the later development of general relativity.

In mathematics, the Riemann hypothesis (also called the Riemann zeta-hypothesis), first formulated by Bernhard Riemann in 1859, is one of the most famous unsolved problems. It has been an open question for well over a century, despite attracting concentrated efforts from many outstanding mathematicians. Unlike some other celebrated problems, it is more attractive to professionals in the field than to amateurs.

The Riemann hypothesis is a conjecture about the distribution of the zeros of the Riemann zeta-function ζ(s). The Riemann zeta-function is defined for all complex numbers s ≠ 1. It has zeros at the negative even integers (i.e. at s = −2, s = −4, s = −6, ...). These are called the trivial zeros. The Riemann hypothesis is concerned with the non-trivial zeros, and states that:

The real part of any non-trivial zero of the Riemann zeta function is ½. 
Thus the non-trivial zeros should lie on the so-called critical line ½ + it with t a real number and i the imaginary unit. The Riemann zeta-function along the critical line is sometimes studied in terms of the Z-function, whose real zeros correspond to the zeros of the zeta-function on the critical line.

 
The real part (red) and imaginary part (blue) of the critical line Re(s) = 1/2 of the Riemann zeta-function. You can see the first non-trivial zeros at Im(s) = ±14.135, ±21.022 and ±25.011. 
A polar graph of zeta, that is, Re(zeta) vs. Im(zeta), along the critical line s=it+1/2, with t running from 0 to 34The Riemann hypothesis is one of the most important open problems of contemporary mathematics; a $1,000,000 prize has been offered by the Clay Mathematics Institute for a proof. Most mathematicians believe the Riemann hypothesis to be true. (J. E. Littlewood and Atle Selberg have been reported as skeptical. Selberg's skepticism, if any, waned, from his young days. In a 1989 paper, he suggested that an analogue should hold for a much wider class of functions, the Selberg class.)'

why is it that air is colder at night than that in day time? Why is it that the air from the sea at night is colder than in day time? The sea, air, and land are all warmed by radiation (light, infrared, etc) from the sun during the day.  The earth also gives off radiation (infrared) all the time.  During the daytime the radiation from the sun is greater than the radiation given off by the earth's surface so the surface warms up.  At night, no radiation from the sun, but the earth is still radiating infrared, so it cools off.

Wot is RNA?  Ribonucleic acid (RNA) is a nucleic acid polymer consisting of covalently bound nucleotides. RNA nucleotides contain ribose rings and uracil unlike deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA), which contains deoxyribose and thymine. It is transcribed from DNA by enzymes called RNA polymerases and further processed by other enzymes. RNA serves as the template for translation of genes into proteins, transferring amino acids to the ribosome to form proteins, and also translating the transcript into proteins.

anybody know the apparatus needed for this experiment? i am trying to carry out an experiment on what kind of milk bacteria grows faster anybody knows what the apparatus needed are? Well, if you want to measure their growth in milk you need:

Pure culture of the bacteria in question, sterile milk, sterile glass tubes and a spectrophotometer.  This will measure the density of the bacteria in liquid culture.  I don't know what equipment you have access too (pipetts, tubes, a spectrophotometer etc).

If you've isolated the bacteria from milk and want to just measure their growth in "whatever", you can use any sterile growth medium that supports the growth of the isolated bacteria.  Again, measuring growth is most easily accomplished by use of a spectrophotometer.  

Growing bacteria on a plate to decide which grows faster is fairly insane, unless they have significant differences in growth.  I mean, are you going to stare at an agar plate for 24 hours just to see that at 14 hours 5 minutes a tiny pinpoint on plate A was visible, but it took 15 hours and 22 minutes for a colony of the same size on plate B?  No, of course you're not, it's not even plausible.

With liquid culture, you can take readings every hour for 8 hours and at 24 hours or something.

You can also dilute and spread-plate the bacteria from liquid cultures onto agar plates if you have your heart set on using them and achieving an exact count for bacterial populations.  But use of a spec still allows for comparisons between species, even without an exact population number.

Help with this substitution Intergral please? 5X^3(1-3X^4)^3/2    dx  

Please include the steps. 

No smart aleck comments needed.
Thanks for your help. Let u = 1-3x^4, then
du = -12x^3 dx
Solve for dx by dividing be -12x^3
dx = du/(-12x^3)

Now substitute and cancel.
5X^3(1-3X^4)^3/2 dx 
= 5x^3(u)^(3/2) (du/(-12x^3))
x^3 cancels.  
5x^3(u)^(3/2) (du/(-12x^3))
= (-5/12)u^(3/2)du
Add one to the exponent of u and then divide by that number
3/2 + 1 = 5/2
(-5/12)u^(3/2)du
= (-5/12)u^(5/2)/(5/2) + C
= (-5/12)*(2/5)u^(5/2) + C
= (-1/6)u^(5/2) + C
Substitute back to get
(-1/6)(1-3x^4)^(5/2) + C

What is magnetic moment?  Moment means rotating effect.

When a door is opened or closed, it will be easy if we apply the force away from the hinge than when applying it near the hinge. Thus the rotating effect (moment) depends on the force and also on the distance between the hinge and the point of application of force.

When two parallel equal forces opposite to each other are applied on a body it will rotate. The rotating effect (moment) is measured by any one of the forces and the distance between the forces. 

When a magnet is placed in a uniform magnetic field, two parallel forces will act on the two poles of the magnet and will rotate it. The moment (rotating effect) is the maximum when the axis of the magnet is perpendicular to the field and will be zero when the axis is in line with the external field.  The maximum moment of the magnet is magnetic moment of that magnet.

It is measured by the product of the magnetic pole strength and the distance between the poles (length of the magnet).

How many non-euclidean geometries are ?  Generally, non-euclidean geometries are geometries that use a different fourth postulate, that, in Euclidean geometry, says that corresponding angles of a transversed parrallel lines are equal.  This basically means that parrallel lines never meet.  There are two other possible postulates.  One is that parrallel lines do meet, i.e. that space is like a globe where longitudinal lines meet at the poles.  The other is that other lines, besides parallel lines don't meet. In this situation space is shaped like a saddle, and lines get farther and farther apart.  Those are the two I know.  There are three other Euclidean postulates (e.g. you can draw exactly one circle through a point in the center and one on the rim) that someone might be able to change, but I am not aware that anyone has done that.

Why don't eskimos get scurvy?  the traditional Eskimo diet consisted largely of meat and fish, with fruits, vegetables, and other carbohydrates--the usual source of vitamin C--accounting for as little as 2 percent of total calorie intake. How do you use an inoculating loop? transferring bacteria from a culture tube to a cuvette (everything needs to be sterile) You need to sterilize the loop before you do the transfer (pass through the flame of a lit Bunsen burner), the you need to let it cool before you do the transfer, or you will fry all the little bacteria that you want to transfer. Then you can actually do the transfer by getting a sample on the loop from the cuvette, and transferring to the cuvette. Keep the cuvette closed until just before you do the transfer, and close it right again after, to avoid airborne contamination. The same goes for the culture tube if it will be used again.

what is time switching and how it relates to TDM?  TDM, or time division multiplexing is a scheme to encode several analog signals through one communications channel.

Let's say that you have three telephone conversations.  An encoder, known as a multiplexer, will combine the three by switching very rapidly through all three conversations.  This is called multiplexing.  

Let's say that the multiplexing speed is 66kHz, which translates roughly to 15 microseconds to complete one multiplex cycle (one divided by 66kHz).  The first 5 microseconds, conversation 1 is switched onto the line, the second 5us, conversation 2 is switched onto the line, and the third 5us conversation 3 is switched onto the line.  The cycle then repeats itself over and over.

If you listened to the communications line, it would sound like you were listening to three conversations simultaneously, like they were blended together.

Now, on the other end of the communications line, a decoder, called a demultiplexer sorts out the three conversations with a precise clock and a time base signal that is added in at the multiplexing process.  So it sorts out the three conversations and seperates them into the three original channels by doing the switching in the exact opposite of the multplexer by again making the switch every 5us.   

Voila, time switching combines three phone conversations over one set of wires.

In cellular phones, there is a scheme known as TDMA, or time division, multiple access.  This is similar concept, but it coordinates multiple cell phone's transmitters to accomplish the same thing, but over radio instead of wires.

What is 5 + 2?  The answer is that 5 + 2 leads to the second number higher than 5 in whatever numbering system you are using.

In a numbering system that has a base of 8 or more, 5 + 2 = 7

In a numbering system that uses "7" as its base, the consecutive counting numbers are 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 10, 11, 12, ..., and 5 + 2 = 10

In a counting system that uses "6" as its base, the consecutive counting munbers are 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 10, 11, 12, 13, ..., and 5 + 2 = 11.

In a counting system using "5" as the base, the expression is meaningless, since there is no counting number 5; i.e. 1, 2, 3, 4, 10, 11, 12, ...

What is the reason why the moon is not full every night? what eclipse the moon?  You know that when it's daytime for you, someone on the other side of Earth is experiencing night time - the Sun lights up half of the earth at any given time.  The same is true for the Moon - it is always half lit up by the Sun and half dark.  But we don't always see the lit up side.  Sometimes we do, like tonight (a Full Moon).  But other times we "see" the dark half (a New Moon) (you can't really see the dark half because it's dark!), and sometimes we see a little bit of both (First Quarter Moon, for example).  

We see different parts of the lit up side and the dark side because the Moon orbits Earth about once every month.  Right now, if you were to see the Sun, Earth, and Moon from high above Earth's north pole, the three would be almost lined up: Sun, then Earth, then Moon.  If they were *perfectly* lined up then there would be a lunar eclipse, but that only happens a couple times a year, if that.  Next week, as the Moon goes around Earth, the Sun, Earth, and Moon will make a right angle and not a straight line.  That's when we see a Third Quarter Moon - only the left half of the Moon will be visible as seen from Earth.  Another week and the Moon will be almost between the Sun and Earth, so the dark side of the Moon will be facing Earth - what we call New Moon.  (If the Moon came exactly between the Sun and Earth we would have a solar eclipse, but just like lunar eclipses they are very rare).

There is a huge difference between a lunar eclipse and a new moon - apparently several of the people who answered above me don't know that!

How deep is the bedrock in different parts of the U.S.? Like the Midwest, West Coast, East Coast, and the South?  And would it be possible to put "bomb-shelter" type chambers in the bedrock without it coming down on people's heads? This is dependent on how much sediment is deposited on top of the bedrock.

In some places, the bedrock is exposed. In others, the bedrock is very deep.

In areas closer to the coast, termed "coastal plains", the bedrock is usually deeper than anywhere else. This is b/c of all the sediments deposited due to rises & falls of sea levels.

As you move closer to mountainous areas, the bedrock is relatively shallow.

As for your other question, it would depend on the type of bedrock as to whether it would be stable & sturdy enough to do what you are proposing.

Metamorphic & igneous bedrock are stable. Some places like in Florida have sedimentary limestone bedrock. That would not be a good place for a "bomb shelter".

what is biodiesel?  Biodiesel is a fuel that is made from either waste oil (collected from restaurants) or pure vegetable oil. It is often mixed with "regular" diesel. You can buy it at some gas stations, although it isn't common. The ratio of biodiesel to regular diesel varies depending on the vehicle and the season (less biodiesel in the winter, for example). 

The benefits of biodiesel include lessening our dependence on foreign oil, increasing our use of renewable resources, especially those that are produced in our own country, and cleaner fuel both in use and in production. 

The US government's standards for regular diesel are not as stringent as they are in other countries, although that will change in the next year or so. Right now, there are few American automakers who produce diesel passenger vehicles. You'll find diesel trucks, but I don't think there are any American made cars. This may change as the quality of diesel improves and as biodiesel becomes more readily available.

Biodiesel is fairly easy to make. There are a lot of "home brewers" out there who collect waste oil from restaurants, filter it as necessary, and process it into biodiesel. My boss makes it in our shop and we use it in our company vehicles. Except for the occasional nasty smelling batch of cooking oil, it's great. We're greatly reducing our company's fuel costs because the diesel vehicles have much better gas mileage, and we're producing the biodiesel for less than $1.25 per gallon.

Which is the most flexible joint in our body??  The joint with the greatest degree of freedom in rotation and angles achievable would probably be the shoulder joint where the humerus connects to the scapula in the glenoid fossa.

The degree of motion in this joint is remarkable, and is probably a legacy of the brachiation ability of our ape forebears.

The flexibility of this joint also probably costs us too, as it is probably one of the most easily injured joints.  Dislocated shoulders and torn rotator cuffs are probably a result of this flexibility, as the joint is not well protected with connective tissue, large slabs of muscle or shelves of bone.

Is space "something" or is space "nothing"? and why is that? As my education impressed on my mind; there is no empty space.  What we think of as "space" is not empty but a constant dance of virtual particals (protons/antiprotons, etc) constantly appearing out of the vacuum travelling a short distance, then touching and annihilating into nothing once again.  

"Empty" space is filled with these interactions which I believe are known as vacuum fluctuations.  The law of "convservation of energy" is really something that holds on average.  Another principle called the uncertainty principle states that we cannot measure simultaneously the energy and time of a (system of particles?) more accurate than a constantant called h or hbar (a very small but finite number). 

So in theory the universe can "borrow" energy from nowhere as long as that energy is returned before the h bar uncertainty in time runs out.  And thus "empty" space is filled with these vacuum fluctuations and is not really empty after all.  Of course I don't think I explained that too well.  See "In Search of Schrodinger's Cat" by John Gribben for a more coherent description

Beverage engineering? The pull tab was a major advance in the engineering desigan of beverage containers.  The tab pivots on a central bolt in the can's top. When you pull upward on one end of the tab, the other end presses downward on a portion of the can's top that has been scored. If you pull upward with a 10N force, approximately what is the magnitude of the force applied to the scored section? Its the ratio of the lengths.

Its balance of angular momentum, so the length from the hinge and the forces exerted must be equal.

10 N exerted upward at  2 cm from the fulcrum means that the downward load 2mm the other direction from the fulcrum is associated with a load of 100 N.

You may not have noticed, but there are special force concentrating deformations in the surface near where the tab presses.  That makes it fail at about 1/2 to 1/3 the load it would otherwise fail at.
